translated: At that time in Bārāṇasī there was a young man called Yasa, the son of a wealthy merchant. He was delicate,

original: Tassa tayo pāsādā honti—
analyzed: tassa tayo pāsādāḥ honti
translated: and he had three palaces:

original: eko hemantiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.
analyzed: ekaḥ hemantikaḥ ekaḥ gimhikaḥ ekaḥ vassikaḥ
translated: one for the cold weather, one for the hot weather, and one for the rainy season.

original: So vassike pāsāde cattāro māse nippurisehi tūriyehi paricārayamāno na heṭṭhāpāsādaṁ orohati.
analyzed: so vassike pāsāde cattāraḥ māse nippurisehi tūriyehi paricārayamānaḥ na heṭṭhā pāsādam orohati
translated: While being entertained by female musicians in the rainy-season palace, he did not go down to the other palaces for four months.

original: Atha kho yasassa kulaputtassa pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitassa samaṅgībhūtassa paricārayamānassa
analyzed: atha kho yasassa kula puttassa pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitassa samaṅgībhūtassa paricārayamānassa
translated: Then, while Yasa was enjoying himself with the five kinds of sensual stimulation,

original: paṭikacceva niddā okkami, parijanassapi niddā okkami, sabbarattiyo ca telapadīpo jhāyati.
analyzed: paṭikaccā iva niddā okkami parijanassa api niddā okkami sabba rattiyaḥ ca tela padīpo jhāyati
translated: he fell asleep first, and so did his attendants. The oil-lamp burned all night.

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto paṭikacceva pabujjhitvā addasa sakaṁ parijanaṁ supantaṁ—
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula putto paṭikacca iva pabujjhitvā addasa sakam parijanam supanta
translated: Yasa woke up before his friends and saw them sleeping,

original: aññissā kacche vīṇaṁ, aññissā kaṇṭhe mudiṅgaṁ, aññissā kacche āḷambaraṁ, aññaṁ vikesikaṁ, aññaṁ vikkheḷikaṁ, aññā vippalapantiyo, hatthappattaṁ susānaṁ maññe.
analyzed: aññissā kacche vīṇa aññissā kaṇṭhe mudiṅga aññissā kacche āḷambara aññam vikesika aññam vikkheḷika aññāḥ vippalapantiyaḥ hattha pattam susānam maññe
translated: with their lutes and drums and flutes scattered all around, some drooling, some snoring, some grinding their teeth, some naked, some with their clothes in disarray. It was as if they were in a charnel ground.

original: Disvānassa ādīnavo pāturahosi, nibbidāya cittaṁ saṇṭhāsi.
analyzed: disvānassa ādīnavaḥ pāturahosi nibbidāya cittam saṇṭhāsi
translated: When he saw this, he became disenchanted, dispassionate, and liberated from the defilements.

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto udānaṁ udānesi—
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula putto udānam udānesi
translated: He then exclaimed:

original: “upaddutaṁ vata bho, upassaṭṭhaṁ vata bho”ti.
analyzed: upaddutam vata bho upassaṭṭham vata bhoti
translated: “How oppressed and afflicted are living beings! How oppressed and afflicted are living beings!”

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto suvaṇṇapādukāyo ārohitvā yena nivesanadvāraṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula putto suvaṇṇa pādukāyaḥ ārohitvā yena nivesana dvāram tena upasaṅkami
translated: He then put on his golden slippers and went to the door of the house.

original: Amanussā dvāraṁ vivariṁsu—
analyzed: amanussāḥ dvāram
translated: Non-human beings opened the door,

original: “mā yasassa kulaputtassa koci antarāyamakāsi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: mā yasassa kula puttassa koci antarāyam akāsi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: thinking, “Let there be no obstacle for Yasa, the young man of good family, who has gone forth from the house to the houseless state.”

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto yena nagaradvāraṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula puttaḥ yena nagara dvāram tena upasaṅkami
translated: Yasa then went to the city gate.🔽Non-human beings opened the gate,

original: Amanussā dvāraṁ vivariṁsu—
analyzed: amanussāḥ dvāram
translated: thinking,

original: “mā yasassa kulaputtassa koci antarāyamakāsi agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: mā yasassa kula puttassa koci antarāyam akāsi agārasma anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “May no one create an obstacle for the young man Yasa to going forth from the home life into homelessness.”

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto yena isipatanaṁ migadāyo tenupasaṅkami.🔽Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya ajjhokāse caṅkamati.
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula putto yena isipatanam migadāyo tena upasaṅkami  tena kho pana samayena bhagavā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya ajjhokāse caṅkamati
translated: Then Yasa went to the Deer Park in Isipatana.🔽At that time the Buddha had gotten up early and was walking back and forth outside.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ, disvāna caṅkamā orohitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: addasā kho bhagavā yasam kula puttam dūratas uva āgacchanta disvāna caṅkamā orohitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: He saw Yasa coming in the distance, and he came down from the walk and sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto bhagavato avidūre udānaṁ udānesi—
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula puttaḥ bhagavataḥ avidūre udānam udānesi
translated: Yasa then exclaimed:

original: “upaddutaṁ vata bho, upassaṭṭhaṁ vata bho”ti.
analyzed: upaddutam vata bho upassaṭṭham vata bhoti
translated: “How oppressed and how crushed I am!”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā yasam kula puttam etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said to him,

original: “idaṁ kho, yasa, anupaddutaṁ, idaṁ anupassaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: idam kho yasa anupadduta idam anupassaṭṭha
translated: “This is not oppressed and crushed.

original: Ehi, yasa, nisīda, dhammaṁ te desessāmī”ti.
analyzed: ehi yasa nisīda dhammam te desessāmi iti
translated: Come, Yasa, sit down and I’ll teach you the Teaching.”

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto—
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula putto
translated: Yasa thought,

original: “idaṁ kira anupaddutaṁ, idaṁ anupassaṭṭhan”ti haṭṭho udaggo suvaṇṇapādukāhi orohitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: idam kira anupaddutaḥ idam anupassaṭṭhanti haṭṭhaḥ udaggaḥ suvaṇṇa pādukāhi orohitvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: “This is not a place of danger or fear,” and he descended from the golden stairs, went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnassa kho yasassa kulaputtassa bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnassa kho yasassa kula puttassa bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha gave him a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ, kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ, nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katha kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesa nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: a talk on generosity, on virtue, on heaven; he revealed the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of renunciation.

original: Yadā bhagavā aññāsi yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ kallacittaṁ, muducittaṁ, vinīvaraṇacittaṁ, udaggacittaṁ, pasannacittaṁ, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā bhagavā aññāsi yasam kula puttam kalla citta mudu citta vinīvaraṇa citta udagga citta pasanna citta atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that Yasa’s mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ, samudayaṁ, nirodhaṁ, maggaṁ.
analyzed: dukkha samudaya nirodha magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
analyzed: evam eva yasassa kula puttassa tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: In the same way, as long as the sun was shining, the dust-free, stainless vision of the Dhamma arose in Yasa:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

original: Atha kho yasassa kulaputtassa mātā pāsādaṁ abhiruhitvā yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ apassantī yena seṭṭhi gahapati tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā seṭṭhiṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho yasassa kula puttassa mātā pāsādam abhiruhitvā yasam kula puttam a passantī yena seṭṭhi gahapati tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā seṭṭhim gahapatim etat avoca
translated: Then Yasa’s mother went up to the roof of the house and, not seeing Yasa, she went to the money-lender and said,

original: “putto te, gahapati, yaso na dissatī”ti.
analyzed: putto te gahapati yasaḥ na dissati iti
translated: “Money-lender, I can’t see Yasa.”

original: Atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati catuddisā assadūte uyyojetvā sāmaṁyeva yena isipatanaṁ migadāyo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati catuddisā assa dūte uyyojetvā sāmayā iva yena isipatanam migadāyo tena upasaṅkami
translated: The money-lender sent messengers in the four directions, while he himself went to the Deer Park in the Game Reserve.

original: Addasā kho seṭṭhi gahapati suvaṇṇapādukānaṁ nikkhepaṁ, disvāna taṁyeva anugamāsi.
analyzed: addasā kho seṭṭhi gahapati suvaṇṇa pādukānam nikkhepa disvāna tayā iva
translated: He saw the discarded golden slippers and followed in Yasa’s footsteps.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā seṭṭhiṁ gahapatiṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ, disvāna bhagavato etadahosi—
analyzed: addasā khalu bhagavā seṭṭhim gahapatim dūratas uva āgacchanta disvāna bhagavataḥ etat ahosi
translated: The Buddha saw the money-lender coming and thought,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ tathārūpaṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkhareyyaṁ yathā seṭṭhi gahapati idha nisinno idha nisinnaṁ yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ na passeyyā”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham tathārūpam iddha abhisaṅkhāram abhisaṅkhareyyam yathā seṭṭhi gahapati idha nisinnaḥ idha nisinnam yasam kula puttam na passeyya ati
translated: “Why don’t I perform a miracle so that the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, while sitting here, doesn’t see the young man Yasa sitting here?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā tathārūpaṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharesi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā tathārūpam iddha abhisaṅkhāram abhisaṅkharesi
translated: And the Buddha performed a miracle so that

original: Atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Anāthapiṇḍika went to the Buddha and said,

original: “api, bhante, bhagavā yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ passeyyā”ti?
analyzed: api bhante bhagavā yasam kula puttam passeyya ati
translated: “Sir, can you see the young man Yasa?”

original: “Tena hi, gahapati, nisīda, appeva nāma idha nisinno idha nisinnaṁ yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ passeyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi gahapati nisīda appā iva nāma idha nisinnaḥ idha nisinnam yasam kula puttam passeyyāsi iti
translated: “Well then, householder, sit down. Perhaps, while sitting here, you’ll see the young man Yasa sitting here.”

original: Atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati—
analyzed: atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati
translated: Anāthapiṇḍika thought,

original: “idheva kirāhaṁ nisinno idha nisinnaṁ yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ passissāmī”ti haṭṭho udaggo bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: idhā iva kira aham nisinnaḥ idha nisinnam yasam kula puttam passissāmi iti haṭṭhaḥ udaggaḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: “I’ll see the young man Yasa sitting right here.” And he was thrilled and elated. He bowed down, sat to one side,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnassa kho seṭṭhissa gahapatissa bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnassa kho seṭṭhissa gahapatissa bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: and the Buddha gave him a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ, kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ, nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katha kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesa nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: He spoke to him about giving, virtue, and heaven, and about the drawbacks, impurities, and defilements of sensuality.

original: Yadā bhagavā aññāsi seṭṭhiṁ gahapatiṁ kallacittaṁ, muducittaṁ, vinīvaraṇacittaṁ, udaggacittaṁ, pasannacittaṁ, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā bhagavā aññāsi seṭṭhim gahapatim kalla citta mudu citta vinīvaraṇa citta udagga citta pasanna citta atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that the merchant’s mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ, samudayaṁ, nirodhaṁ, maggaṁ.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: dukkha samudaya nirodha magga  seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.🔽Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva seṭṭhissa gahapatissa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
analyzed: evam eva seṭṭhissa gahapatissa tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way, while he was sitting right there, the merchant experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

original: Atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati diṭṭha dhammo patta dhammo vidita dhammo pariyogāḷha dhammo tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ vigata kathaṅkatho vesārajja ppatto apara ppaccayaḥ satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then the banker, having seen the Dhamma, attained the Dhamma, understood the Dhamma, penetrated the Dhamma, crossed over uncertainty, being without doubts, having attained full confidence, having become independent of others in the Teacher’s teaching, said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya—
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante  seyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya
translated: “Magnificent, reverend Sir! Magnificent, reverend Sir!

original: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as, reverend Sir, one might set upright what has been overturned, or open up what has been closed, or show a path to one who is lost, or bear an oil lamp in the darkness so that one who has eyes can see forms—

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the Fortunate One in more than one way.

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go, reverend Sir, to the Fortunate One for refuge, and to the Dhamma, and to the Community of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May the Fortunate One remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge from this day forward for life.”

original: Sova loke paṭhamaṁ upāsako ahosi tevāciko.
analyzed: saḥ uva loke paṭhamam upāsakaḥ ahosi tevācikaḥ
translated: He was the first lay follower in the world with the three(-part) formula.

original: Atha kho yasassa kulaputtassa pituno dhamme desiyamāne yathādiṭṭhaṁ yathāviditaṁ bhūmiṁ paccavekkhantassa anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimucci.
analyzed: atha kho yasassa kula puttassa pituno dhamme desiyamāne yathādiṭṭham yathā viditam bhūmim paccavekkhantassa an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimucci
translated: Then, while the householder’s father was teaching him the Teaching, Yasassin reflected on the Teaching according to his view and his understanding, and his mind was freed from the corruptions through letting go.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: The Buddha thought,

original: “yasassa kho kulaputtassa pituno dhamme desiyamāne yathādiṭṭhaṁ yathāviditaṁ bhūmiṁ paccavekkhantassa anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuttaṁ.
analyzed: yasassa kho kula puttassa pituno dhamme desiyamāne yathādiṭṭham yathā viditam bhūmim paccavekkhantassa an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimutta
translated: “While the householder’s father was teaching him the Teaching, Yasassin reflected on the Teaching according to his view and his understanding, and his mind was freed from the corruptions through letting go.

original: Abhabbo kho yaso kulaputto hīnāyāvattitvā kāme paribhuñjituṁ, seyyathāpi pubbe agārikabhūto;
analyzed: abhabbaḥ kho yaso kula puttaḥ hīnāya avattitvā kāme paribhuñjitu seyyathā api pubbe agārika bhūtaḥ
translated: He’s incapable of returning to the lower life and enjoying worldly pleasures as he did before.

original: yannūnāhaṁ taṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ paṭippassambheyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham tam iddha abhisaṅkhāram paṭippassambheyyanti
translated: Let me now cancel that miracle.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā taṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ paṭippassambhesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tam iddha abhisaṅkhāram paṭippassambhesi
translated: And he did just that.

original: Addasā kho seṭṭhi gahapati yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ nisinnaṁ disvāna, yasaṁ kulaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: addasā kho seṭṭhi gahapati yasam kula puttam nisinnam disvāna yasam kula puttam etat avoca
translated: The merchant saw Yasassin sitting there, and he said to him,

original: “mātā te, tāta yasa, paridevasokasamāpannā, dehi mātuyā jīvitan”ti.
analyzed: mātā te tāta parideva soka samāpannā dehi mātuyāḥ jīvitanti
translated: “Dear Yasassin, your mother is lamenting and grieving. Give her back her life.”

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto bhagavantaṁ ullokesi.
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula puttaḥ bhagavantam ullokesi
translated: Yasa looked up at the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā seṭṭhiṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca—🔽“taṁ kiṁ maññasi, gahapati, yassa sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammo diṭṭho
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā seṭṭhim gahapatim etat avoca  tam kim maññasi gahapati yassa sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammaḥ diṭṭho
translated: The Buddha said to the householder:🔽“What do you think, householder? If someone has seen the Dhamma for themselves and come to the true way by the discernment and vision of one in training,

original: vidito seyyathāpi tayā, tassa yathādiṭṭhaṁ yathāviditaṁ bhūmiṁ paccavekkhantassa
analyzed: viditaḥ seyyathā api tayā tassa yathādiṭṭham yathā viditam bhūmim paccavekkhantassa
translated: and if they reflect on the level they have seen and known,

original: anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuttaṁ.
analyzed: an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimutta
translated: their mind is freed from the defilements through lack of clinging.

original: Bhabbo nu kho so, gahapati, hīnāyāvattitvā kāme paribhuñjituṁ seyyathāpi pubbe agārikabhūto”ti?
analyzed: bhabbaḥ nu kho saḥ gahapati hīnāya avattitvā kāme paribhuñjitum seyyathā api pubbe agārika bhūtaḥ ti
translated: Would it be possible for them to return to the lower life and enjoy worldly pleasures as they did before they went forth?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.🔽“Yasassa kho, gahapati, kulaputtassa sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammo diṭṭho
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante  yasassa kho gahapati kula puttassa sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammaḥ diṭṭho
translated: “No, Venerable Sir.”🔽“Yasa has seen the Dhamma for himself and come to the true way by the discernment and vision of one in training,

original: vidito seyyathāpi tayā, tassa yathādiṭṭhaṁ yathāviditaṁ bhūmiṁ paccavekkhantassa
analyzed: viditaḥ seyyathā api tayā tassa yathādiṭṭham yathā viditam bhūmim paccavekkhantassa
translated: and if he reflects on the level he has seen and known,

original: anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuttaṁ.
analyzed: an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimutta
translated: his mind is freed from the defilements through lack of clinging.

original: Abhabbo kho, gahapati, yaso kulaputto hīnāyāvattitvā kāme paribhuñjituṁ seyyathāpi pubbe agārikabhūto”ti.
analyzed: abhabbaḥ kho gahapati yasaḥ kula putto hīnāya avattitvā kāme paribhuñjitum seyyathā api pubbe agārika bhūto ti
translated: Yasa is incapable of returning to the lower life and enjoying worldly pleasures as he did in the past.”

original: “Lābhā, bhante, yasassa kulaputtassa, suladdhaṁ, bhante, yasassa kulaputtassa, yathā yasassa kulaputtassa anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuttaṁ.
analyzed: lābhā bhante yasassa kula puttassa suladdha bhante yasassa kula puttassa yathā yasassa kula puttassa an upādāya āsavehi cittam
translated: “It’s a great gain for Yasa, Venerable Sir, it’s very profitable for Yasa, that his mind is freed from the corruptions through letting go.

original: Adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā ajjatanāya bhattaṁ yasena kulaputtena pacchāsamaṇenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhante bhagavā ajjatanāya bhattam yasena kula puttena pacchā samaṇena ati
translated: Please accept today’s meal from me, together with Yasa as my attendant.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho seṭṭhi gahapati bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, the merchant got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho yaso kulaputto acirapakkante seṭṭhimhi gahapatimhi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho yasaḥ kula puttaḥ acira pakkante seṭṭhimhi gahapatimhi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Soon afterwards Yasa said to the Buddha,

original: “labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyya āha bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti
translated: “Sir, may I receive the going forth in the Buddha’s presence? May I receive the full ordination?”

original: “Ehi bhikkhū”ti bhagavā avoca—
analyzed: ehi bhikkhu iti bhagavā avoca
translated: “Come, monk,” said the Buddha.

original: “svākkhāto dhammo, cara brahmacariyaṁ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ dhammaḥ cara brahmacariyam sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati
translated: “The Dhamma is well-expounded. Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”

original: Sāva tassa āyasmato upasampadā ahosi.
analyzed: sā ava tassa āyasmataḥ upasampadā ahosi
translated: And that was the venerable Yasa’s full admission into monkhood.

original: Tena kho pana samayena satta loke arahanto honti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena satta loke arahantaḥ honti
translated: At that time there were seven perfected ones in the world.

original: Yasassa pabbajjā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yasassa pabbajjā niṭṭhitā
translated: The account of Yasa’s going forth is finished.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āyasmatā yasena pacchāsamaṇena yena seṭṭhissa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya āyasmatā yasena pacchāsamaṇena yena seṭṭhissa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: Then, when it was morning, the Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and with the venerable Yasa as his attendant, he went to the house of the merchant householder. He then sat down on the prepared seat

original: Atha kho āyasmato yasassa mātā ca purāṇadutiyikā ca yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ yasassa mātā ca purāṇadutiyikā ca yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: and Yasa’s mother and ex-wife went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

original: Tāsaṁ bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tāsam bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching.

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ, kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ, nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katha kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesa nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: He explained about giving, virtue, heaven, the drawbacks, disadvantages, and defilements of sense pleasures, and the benefits of renunciation.

original: Yadā tā bhagavā aññāsi kallacittā, muducittā, vinīvaraṇacittā, udaggacittā, pasannacittā, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā tāḥ bhagavā aññāsi kalla cittāḥ mudu cittāḥ vinīvaraṇa cittāḥ udagga cittāḥ pasanna cittāḥ atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ, samudayaṁ, nirodhaṁ, maggaṁ.
analyzed: dukkha samudaya nirodha magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva tāsaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
analyzed: evam eva tāsam tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way the dustless and stainless eye of Dhamma arose in them:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

original: Tā diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: tāḥ diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammāḥ vidita dhammāḥ pariyogāḷha dhammāḥ tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: They had seen the truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. They then said to the Buddha,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante pe
translated: “Excellent, Sir! Excellent! …

original: etā mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: etāḥ bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: We go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

original: Upāsikāyo no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetā saraṇaṁ gatā”ti.
analyzed: upāsikāyaḥ naḥ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetā saraṇam gatā ati
translated: May the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: Tā ca loke paṭhamaṁ upāsikā ahesuṁ tevācikā.🔽Atha kho āyasmato yasassa mātā ca pitā ca purāṇadutiyikā ca bhagavantañca āyasmantañca
analyzed: tā ca loke paṭhamam upāsikāḥ ahesum tevācikā  atha kho āyasmataḥ yasassa mātā ca pitā ca purāṇa dutiyikā ca bhagavantañca āyasmantañca
translated: They were the first female lay followers in the world to be called “followers by oral tradition.”🔽Then Yasa’s mother, father, and ex-wife,🔽after personally serving and satisfying the Buddha and Yasa with their own hands,

original: yasaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā, bhagavantaṁ🔽bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ, ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: yasam paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavanta  bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇi ekamantam
translated: when the Buddha had eaten and had withdrawn his hand from the bowl,🔽sat down to one side.🔽The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmato yasassa mātarañca pitarañca purāṇadutiyikañca dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā āyasmataḥ yasassa mātaram ca pitaram ca purāṇadutiyikam ca dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: They then got up from their seats and left.

original: Assosuṁ kho āyasmato yasassa cattāro gihisahāyakā bārāṇasiyaṁ seṭṭhānuseṭṭhīnaṁ kulānaṁ puttā—
analyzed: assosum kho āyasmataḥ yasassa cattāraḥ gihi sahāyakāḥ bārāṇasiyam seṭṭha anuseṭṭhīnam kulānam puttā
translated: Yasa’s four friends from the great families of Bārāṇasī—

original: vimalo, subāhu, puṇṇaji, gavampati—
analyzed: vimalaḥ su bāhu puṇṇaji gavampati
translated: Vimalo, Subāhu, Puṇṇaji, and Gavampati—🔽heard that Yasa

original: yaso kira kulaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitoti.🔽Sutvāna nesaṁ etadahosi—🔽“na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha yaso kulaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito”ti.
analyzed: yasaḥ kira kula putto kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitoti  sutvāna etad ahosi  na hi nūna saḥ orakaḥ dhamma vinayaḥ na sā orakā pabbajjā yattha yasaḥ kula putto kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitoti
translated: Yasa has shaved off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and gone forth from the household life into homelessness.”

original: Te yenāyasmā yaso tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ yasaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu.
analyzed: te yena ayasmā yaso tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam yasam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu
translated: When they heard this, they thought, “It must be a good spiritual path and a good going forth, since Yasa has shaved off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and gone forth from the household life into homelessness.”🔽They went to Yasa, bowed, and sat down.

original: Atha kho āyasmā yaso te cattāro gihisahāyake ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā yaso te cattāraḥ gihi sahāyake ādāya yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Yasa then took his four friends to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā yaso bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā yasaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He said,

original: “ime me, bhante, cattāro gihisahāyakā bārāṇasiyaṁ seṭṭhānuseṭṭhīnaṁ kulānaṁ puttā—
analyzed: ime me bhante cattāraḥ gihi sahāyakāḥ bārāṇasiyam seṭṭha anuseṭṭhīnam kulānam puttā
translated: “Sir, these four friends of mine are the sons of leading clans of Rājagaha:

original: vimalo, subāhu, puṇṇaji, gavampati.
analyzed: vimalaḥ su bāhu puṇṇaji gavampati
translated: Vimalo, Subāhu, Puṇṇaji, and Gavampati.

original: Ime bhagavā ovadatu anusāsatū”ti.
analyzed: ime bhagavā ovadatu anusāsatu uti
translated: Please advise and instruct them.”

original: Tesaṁ bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tesam bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katham kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: that is, talk on generosity, talk on morality, talk on heaven, talk on the drawbacks, lowliness, and defilement of sensuality, and the benefits of renunciation.🔽When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
analyzed: yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kalla citte mudu citte vinīvaraṇa citte udagga citte pasanna citte atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi dukkham samudayam nirodham magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva tesaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
analyzed: evam eva tesam tasmiya eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way, while they were sitting right there, the dust-free, stainless eye of Dhamma arose in them:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Whatever has the nature to arise, all that has the nature to stop.”

original: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: te diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammā vidita dhammā pariyogāḷha dhammā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avocu
translated: They had seen the truth, had reached, had penetrated, had fully understood the Truth, had passed beyond doubt, had thrown off uncertainty, had gained perfect confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. They then said to the Buddha,

original: “labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyyāma bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyāma upasampadanti
translated: “Sir, may we receive the going forth in the Buddha’s presence? May we receive the full ordination?”

original: “Etha bhikkhavo”ti bhagavā avoca—
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti bhagavā avoca
translated: “Come, monks!” the Buddha said.

original: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṁ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ dhammaḥ caratha brahmacariyam sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati
translated: “The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

original: Sāva tesaṁ āyasmantānaṁ upasampadā ahosi.🔽Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi anusāsi.
analyzed: sā ava tesam āyasmantānam upasampadā ahosi  atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi anusāsi
translated: And that was the full ordination of those venerables.🔽The Buddha instructed and taught those monks,

original: Tesaṁ bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya ovadiyamānānaṁ anusāsiyamānānaṁ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
analyzed: tesam bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya ovadiyamānānam anusāsiyamānānam an upādāya āsavehi cittāni
translated: and as they were instructed and taught, their minds were freed from the corruptions through letting go.

original: Tena kho pana samayena ekādasa loke arahanto honti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena ekādasa loke arahantaḥ honti
translated: At that time there were eleven perfected ones in the world.

original: Catugihisahāyakapabbajjā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catugihi sahāyaka pabbajjā niṭṭhitā
translated: The account of the four friends who went forth is finished.

original: Assosuṁ kho āyasmato yasassa paññāsamattā gihisahāyakā jānapadā pubbānupubbakānaṁ kulānaṁ puttā—
analyzed: assosum kho āyasmataḥ yasassa paññāsa mattāḥ gihi sahāyakāḥ jānapadāḥ pubbānupubbakānam kulānam puttāḥ
translated: The Venerable Yasa’s fifty householder friends from the countryside, sons of leading clansmen, heard that Yasa had gone forth into homelessness in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: yaso kira kulaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitoti.🔽Sutvāna nesaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: yasaḥ kira kula putto kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitoti  sutvāna etad ahosi
translated: Fifty of Yasa’s friends from leading families in the countryside heard that Yasa had shaved off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and gone forth into homelessness.

original: “na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha yaso kulaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito”ti.
analyzed: na hi nūna saḥ orakaḥ dhamma vinayaḥ na sā orakā pabbajjā yattha yasaḥ kula putto kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitoti
translated: They thought, “It can’t be an inferior spiritual path and practice, or an inferior going forth, if Yasa has shaved off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and gone forth into homelessness.”

original: Te yenāyasmā yaso tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ yasaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu.
analyzed: te yena ayasmā yaso tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam yasam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu
translated: They went to Yasa, bowed, and sat down.

original: Atha kho āyasmā yaso te paññāsamatte gihisahāyake ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā yaso te paññāsa matte gihi sahāyake ādāya yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Yasa then took those fifty friends to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā yaso bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā yasaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “ime me, bhante, paññāsamattā gihisahāyakā jānapadā pubbānupubbakānaṁ kulānaṁ puttā.
analyzed: ime me bhante paññāsa mattāḥ gihi sahāyakāḥ jānapadāḥ pubba anupubbakānam kulānam puttāḥ
translated: “These fifty lay followers from the countryside are the sons of my old friends.

original: Ime bhagavā ovadatu anusāsatū”ti.
analyzed: ime bhagavā ovadatu anusāsatu uti
translated: Please give them a teaching.”

original: Tesaṁ bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tesam bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katham kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi

original: Atha kho sā vesī tesu pamattesu paricārentesu bhaṇḍaṁ ādāya palāyittha.🔽Atha kho te sahāyakā sahāyakassa veyyāvaccaṁ karontā, taṁ itthiṁ gavesantā, taṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ āhiṇḍantā addasaṁsu bhagavantaṁ aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho sā vesī tesu pamattesu paricārentesu bhaṇḍam ādāya palāyittha  atha kho te sahāyakā sahāyakassa veyyāvaccam karontā tam itthim gavesantā tam vanasaṇḍam āhiṇḍantā addasasu bhagavantam aññatarasmin rukkha mūle nisinna
translated: While they were enjoying themselves, the prostitute took his money and ran away.🔽As those friends were looking for her, they came to that grove and saw the Buddha sitting at the foot of a tree.

original: Disvāna yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—🔽“api, bhante, bhagavā ekaṁ itthiṁ passeyyā”ti?
analyzed: disvāna yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam etat avocuḥ  api bhante bhagavā ekam itthim passeyya ati
translated: They went up to him and said,🔽“Sir, have you seen a woman?”

original: “Kiṁ pana vo, kumārā, itthiyā”ti?
analyzed: kim pana vaḥ kumārāḥ itthiyā ati
translated: “But why do you need a woman?”

original: “Idha mayaṁ, bhante, tiṁsamattā bhaddavaggiyā sahāyakā sapajāpatikā imasmiṁ vanasaṇḍe paricārimhā.
analyzed: idha bhante tisa mattā bhaddavaggiyā sahāyakā sa pajāpatikā imasmin vana saṇḍe paricārimhā
translated: “We were enjoying ourselves with our wives in this forest grove, sir.

original: Ekassa pajāpati nāhosi;
analyzed: ekassa pajāpati na ahosi
translated: One of us didn’t have a wife,

original: tassa atthāya vesī ānītā ahosi.🔽Atha kho sā, bhante, vesī amhesu pamattesu paricārentesu bhaṇḍaṁ ādāya palāyittha.
analyzed: tassa atthāya vesī ānītā ahosi  atha kho sā bhante vesī amhesu pamattesu paricārentesu bhaṇḍam ādāya palāyittha
translated: so we brought a prostitute for him.🔽But while we were enjoying ourselves, that prostitute stole our belongings and ran off.

original: Te mayaṁ, bhante, sahāyakā sahāyakassa veyyāvaccaṁ karontā, taṁ itthiṁ gavesantā, imaṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ āhiṇḍāmā”ti.
analyzed: te maya bhante sahāyakā sahāyakassa veyyāvaccam karontā tam itthim gavesantā imam vanasaṇḍam āhiṇḍāma ati
translated: We’ve been searching for her in this forest grove.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññatha vo, kumārā, katamaṁ nu kho tumhākaṁ varaṁ—
analyzed: tam kim maññatha vaḥ kumārā katamam nu kho tumhākam vara
translated: “What do you think, young men? Which is better for you—

original: yaṁ vā tumhe itthiṁ gaveseyyātha, yaṁ vā attānaṁ gaveseyyāthā”ti?
analyzed: yam vā tumhe itthim gaveseyyātha yam vā attānam gaveseyyātha ati
translated: that you search for a woman, or that you search for yourselves?”

original: “Etadeva, bhante, amhākaṁ varaṁ yaṁ mayaṁ attānaṁ gaveseyyāmā”ti.
analyzed: etat eva bhante amhākam varam yam mayam attānam gaveseyyāma ati
translated: “It’s better that we search for ourselves.”

original: “Tena hi vo, kumārā, nisīdatha, dhammaṁ vo desessāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi vaḥ kumārāḥ nisīdatha dhammam vaḥ desessāmi iti
translated: “Well then, young men, sit down, and I’ll teach you the Dhamma.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhaddavaggiyā sahāyakā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti khalu te bhaddavaggiyāḥ sahāyakāḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: “Yes, sir,” they replied. They bowed to the Buddha and sat down to one side.

original: Tesaṁ bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tesam bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha gave them a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katham kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: that is, talk on generosity, talk on morality, talk on heaven, and he explained the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of renunciation.🔽When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
analyzed: yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kalla citte mudu citte vinīvaraṇa citte udagga citte pasanna citte atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi dukkham samudayam nirodham magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva tesaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
analyzed: evam eva tesam tasmiya eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way, while they were sitting right there, the dust-free, stainless eye of Dhamma arose in them:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Whatever has the nature to arise, all that has the nature to stop.”

original: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: te diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammā vidita dhammā pariyogāḷha dhammā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avocu
translated: Having seen the Dhamma, attained the Dhamma, known the Dhamma, realized the Dhamma, having crossed over and beyond uncertainty, having no more perplexity, having gained fearlessness and independence from others regarding the Teacher’s instructions, they said to the Buddha,🔽“Excellent, sir! Excellent! As if someone were to set up what had been knocked down, or to point out the way to one who had got lost, or to bring a lamp into a dark place, so that those with eyes could see what was there—🔽just so has Master Gotama shown me the Teaching in various ways.

original: “labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyyāma bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyāma upasampadanti
translated: “Sir, may we receive the going forth in the Buddha’s presence? May we receive the full ordination?”

original: “Etha bhikkhavo”ti bhagavā avoca—
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti bhagavā avoca
translated: “Come, monks!” the Buddha said.

original: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṁ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ dhammaḥ caratha brahmacariyam sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati
translated: “The Teaching has been well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

original: Sāva tesaṁ āyasmantānaṁ upasampadā ahosi.🔽Bhaddavaggiyasahāyakānaṁ vatthu niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: sā ava tesam āyasmantānam upasampadā ahosi  bhadda vaggiya sahāyakānam vatthu
translated: And that was the full ordination of those venerables.🔽The account of the good group of friends is finished.

original: Dutiyabhāṇavāro.
analyzed: dutiya bhāṇa vāraḥ
translated: The second recitation section.

original: 12. Uruvelapāṭihāriyakathā
analyzed: uruvela pāṭihāriya kathā
translated: The account of the miracles at Uruvelā

original: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena uruvelā tadavasari.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena uru velā tat avasari
translated: When the Buddha had wandered on for alms in Nādika, he went to Uruvelā.

original: Tena kho pana samayena uruvelāyaṁ tayo jaṭilā paṭivasanti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena uruvelāyam tayaḥ jaṭilā paṭivasanti
translated: At that time there were three dreadlocked ascetics living at Uruvelā:

original: uruvelakassapo, nadīkassapo, gayākassapoti.
analyzed: uruvela kassapaḥ nadīkassapaḥ gayākassapaḥ ti
translated: Uruvelakassapa, Nadīkassapa, and Gayākassapa.

original: Tesu uruvelakassapo jaṭilo pañcannaṁ jaṭilasatānaṁ nāyako hoti, vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
analyzed: tesu uruvelakassapaḥ jaṭilo pañcannam jaṭila satānam nāyakaḥ hoti vināyakaḥ aggaḥ pamukhaḥ pāmokkhaḥ
translated: Uruvelakassapa was the leader, chief, principal, and senior of five hundred dreadlocked ascetics.

original: Nadīkassapo jaṭilo tiṇṇaṁ jaṭilasatānaṁ nāyako hoti, vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
analyzed: nadīkassapaḥ jaṭilaḥ tiṇṇam jaṭila satānam nāyakaḥ hoti vināyakaḥ aggaḥ pamukhaḥ pāmokkhaḥ
translated: Nadīkassapa was the leader, chief, principal, and senior of three hundred dreadlocked ascetics.

original: Gayākassapo jaṭilo dvinnaṁ jaṭilasatānaṁ nāyako hoti, vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
analyzed: gayākassapaḥ jaṭilaḥ dvinnam jaṭila satānam nāyakaḥ hoti vināyakaḥ aggaḥ pamukhaḥ pāmokkhaḥ
translated: Gayākassapa was the leader and guide of two hundred yogis.

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa assamo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa assamaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā uruvelakassapam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: Then the Buddha went to the fire hut of Uruvelā Kassapa and said to him,

original: “sace te, kassapa, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṁ agyāgāre”ti?
analyzed: sace te kassapa agaru vaseyyāmaḥ eka rattam agya āgāre iti
translated: “If it’s not inconvenient for you, Kassapa, I’ll stay one night in the fire hut.”

original: “Na kho me, mahāsamaṇa, garu, caṇḍettha nāgarājā iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso, so taṁ mā viheṭhesī”ti.
analyzed: na kho me mahā samaṇa nāga rājā iddhimā āsi visaḥ ghora visaḥ saḥ tam mā viheṭhesi iti
translated: “It’s not inconvenient for me, Great Ascetic, but there is a fierce dragon-king there with supernormal powers and a poisonous bite. Don’t let it harm you.”

original: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: dutiyam pi khalu bhagavān uruvelakassapam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: A second time the Buddha said to Kassapa,

original: “sace te, kassapa, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṁ agyāgāre”ti?
analyzed: sace te kassapa agaru vaseyyāmaḥ eka rattam agya āgāre iti
translated: “If it’s not inconvenient for you, Kassapa, I’ll stay one night in the fire hut.”

original: “Na kho me, mahāsamaṇa, garu, caṇḍettha nāgarājā iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso, so taṁ mā viheṭhesī”ti.
analyzed: na kho me mahā samaṇa nāga rājā iddhimā āsi visaḥ ghora visaḥ saḥ tam mā viheṭhesi iti
translated: “It’s not inconvenient for me, Great Ascetic, but there is a fierce dragon-king there with supernormal powers and a poisonous bite. Don’t let it harm you.”

original: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu bhagavān uruvelakassapam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: A third time the Buddha said to Kassapa,

original: “sace te, kassapa, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṁ agyāgāre”ti?
analyzed: sace te kassapa agaru vaseyyāmaḥ eka rattam agya āgāre iti
translated: “If it’s not inconvenient for you, Kassapa, I’ll stay one night in the fire hut.”

original: “Na kho me, mahāsamaṇa, garu, caṇḍettha nāgarājā iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso, so taṁ mā viheṭhesī”ti.
analyzed: na kho me mahā samaṇa nāga rājā iddhimā āsi visaḥ ghora visaḥ saḥ tam mā viheṭhesi iti
translated: “I’m not afraid, but that dragon king is powerful, with a poisonous and deadly bite. He might harm you.”

original: “Appeva maṁ na viheṭheyya, iṅgha tvaṁ, kassapa, anujānāhi agyāgāran”ti.
analyzed: appā iva mama na viheṭheyya iṅgha tva kassapa anujānāhi
translated: “Even if he does harm me, still give me permission to stay in the fire hut.”

original: “Vihara, mahāsamaṇa, yathāsukhan”ti.
analyzed: vihara mahā samaṇa
translated: “Stay as long as you like, Great Ascetic.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā agyāgāraṁ pavisitvā tiṇasanthārakaṁ paññapetvā nisīdi pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā agya āgāram pavisitvā tiṇa santhārakam paññapetvā nisīdi pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā
translated: The Buddha entered the fire hut, prepared a straw mat, and sat down cross-legged, with his body upright, and mindfulness well established.

original: Addasā kho so nāgo bhagavantaṁ paviṭṭhaṁ, disvāna dummano padhūpāyi.
analyzed: addasā kho saḥ nāgaḥ bhagavantam paviṭṭha disvāna dummanaḥ padhūpāyi
translated: The dragon saw that the Buddha had entered the fire hut, and he was displeased. He started to smoke.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: The Buddha thought,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ imassa nāgassa anupahacca chaviñca cammañca maṁsañca nhāruñca aṭṭhiñca aṭṭhimiñjañca tejasā tejaṁ pariyādiyeyyan”ti.

translated: “Why don’t I overpower the heat of that dragon without burning his skin, his flesh, his sinews, his bones, or his bone marrow?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā tathārūpaṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā padhūpāyi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā tathārūpam iddha abhisaṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā padhūpāyi
translated: And he did just that.

original: Atha kho so nāgo makkhaṁ asahamāno pajjali.

translated: The dragon couldn’t stand the heat and he burst into flames.

original: Bhagavāpi tejodhātuṁ samāpajjitvā pajjali.
analyzed: bhagavān api tejaḥ dhātum samāpajjitvā pajjali
translated: The Buddha did the same.

translated: The yogis gathered around it and said,

analyzed: abhirūpaḥ vata bho mahā samaṇaḥ nāgena viheṭhiyati iti  atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyāḥ accayena tassa nāgassa anupahacca chaviñca cammañca
translated: “The Great Ascetic is handsome, but he’s being harmed by the dragon.”🔽When the night had passed, the Buddha, without harming the dragon’s skin, flesh, sinews, bones, or bone marrow,

analyzed: masam ca nhārum ca aṭṭhiñca aṭṭhimiñjañca tejasā tejam pariyādiyitvā patte pakkhipitvā

translated: and showed it to Uruvelakassapa,

translated: Uruvelakassapa thought,

translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can overpower the power of the Dragon King Caṇḍa, the Dragon King Mahānagna, the Dragon King Aravāḷa, and the Dragon King Erakapatta. But he is not a Worthy One like me.”

translated: “If it is not troublesome to you, Kassapa,

original: Sakideva pañca kaṭṭhasatāni phāliyiṁsu.
analyzed: sakideva pañca kaṭṭha satāni phāliyisu
translated: And all five hundred pieces of firewood were split at once.

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: Uruvelā Kassapa thought,

original: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma kaṭṭhānipi phāliyissanti, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
analyzed: mahiddhikaḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ yatra hi nāma na tu eva ca kho arahā yathā
translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can split wood, but he’s not a perfected one like me.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā aggiṁ paricaritukāmā na sakkonti aggiṁ ujjaletuṁ.🔽Atha kho tesaṁ jaṭilānaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena te jaṭilāḥ aggim paricaritu kāmāḥ na sakkonti aggim ujjaletu  atha khalu tesam jaṭilānam etat ahosi
translated: On that occasion the dreadlocked ascetics wanted to tend the sacred fire, but they were unable to light it.

original: “nissaṁsayaṁ kho mahāsamaṇassa iddhānubhāvo, yathā mayaṁ na sakkoma aggiṁ ujjaletun”ti.
analyzed: kho mahā samaṇassa iddha anubhāvaḥ yathā mayam na sakkoma aggim ujjaletun ti
translated: They thought, “There’s no doubt that this is the doing of the Great Ascetic, in that we’re unable to light the fire.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān uruvelakassapam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

original: “ujjaliyantu, kassapa, aggī”ti.
analyzed: ujjaliyantu kassapa aggī iti
translated: “Kassapa, let the fire be lit.”

original: “Ujjaliyantu, mahāsamaṇā”ti.
analyzed: ujjaliyantu
translated: “Let it be lit, Great Ascetic.”

original: Sakideva pañca aggisatāni ujjaliyiṁsu.
analyzed: sakideva pañca aggi satāni
translated: And all five hundred fires were lit at once.

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: Uruvelā Kassapa thought,

original: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma aggīpi ujjaliyissanti, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
analyzed: mahiddhikaḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ yatra hi nāma aggīpi ujjaliyissanti na tu eva ca kho arahā yathā
translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can light the fires, but he’s not a perfected one like me.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā aggiṁ paricaritvā na sakkonti aggiṁ vijjhāpetuṁ.🔽Atha kho tesaṁ jaṭilānaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilāḥ aggim paricaritvā na sakkonti aggim vijjhāpetu  atha khalu tesam jaṭilānam etat ahosi
translated: But after tending the sacred fire, they were unable to put it out.

analyzed: nissasayam kho mahāsamaṇassa iddha anubhāvaḥ yathā mayam na sakkoma aggim vijjhāpetunti
translated: They thought, “There’s no doubt that this is the supernormal power of the Great Ascetic, since we’re unable to put out the fire.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān uruvelakassapam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

original: “vijjhāyantu, kassapa, aggī”ti.
analyzed: vijjhāyantu kassapa aggī iti
translated: “Kassapa, let the fire be put out.”

original: “Vijjhāyantu, mahāsamaṇā”ti.
analyzed: vijjhāyantu mahā samaṇā ati
translated: “Let it be put out, Great Ascetic.”

original: Sakideva pañca aggisatāni vijjhāyiṁsu.
analyzed: sakideva pañca aggi satāni vijjhāyisu
translated: And all five hundred fires were put out.

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: Uruvelā Kassapa thought,

original: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma aggīpi vijjhāyissanti, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
analyzed: mahiddhikaḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ yatra hi nāma aggīpi vijjhāyissanti na tu eva ca kho arahā yathā
translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can put out the fire, but he’s not a perfected one like me.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā sītāsu hemantikāsu rattīsu antaraṭṭhakāsu himapātasamaye najjā nerañjarāya ummujjantipi, nimujjantipi, ummujjananimujjanampi karonti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena te jaṭilā sītāsu hemantikāsu rattīsu antaraṭṭhakāsu himapāta samaye najjā nerañjarāya ummujjanti ipi nimujjanti ipi ummujjana nimujjanam karonti
translated: On one occasion, when it was cold in the winter, during the “between-the-heavens” cold season, when snow fell in the uplands, those dreadlocked ascetics were immersing themselves in the Nerañjarā River, diving in and out, and doing submergence practices.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pañcamattāni mandāmukhisatāni abhinimmini, yattha te jaṭilā uttaritvā visibbesuṁ.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā pañcamattāni mandāmukhi satāni yattha te jaṭilāḥ uttaritvā visibbesu
translated: The Buddha then created five hundred fire-sticks, and the knotted-haired ascetics used them to dry themselves.

original: Atha kho tesaṁ jaṭilānaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha khalu tesam jaṭilānam etat ahosi
translated: They thought,

original: “nissaṁsayaṁ kho mahāsamaṇassa iddhānubhāvo, yathayimā mandāmukhiyo nimmitā”ti.
analyzed: nissasayam kho mahā samaṇassa iddha anubhāvaḥ yathayimāḥ mandāmukhiyaḥ nimmitā ati
translated: “There’s no doubt that this is the supernormal power of the Great Ascetic, in that he has created these fire-sticks.”

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: Uruvelakassapa thought,

original: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma tāva bahū mandāmukhiyopi abhinimminissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
analyzed: mahiddhikaḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ yatra hi nāma tāva bahū na tu eva ca kho arahā yathā
translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he can create so many fire-sticks, but he’s not a perfected one like me.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena mahā akālamegho pāvassi, mahā udakavāhako sañjāyi.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena mahā akāla meghaḥ pāvassi mahā udaka vāhako sañjāyi
translated: Soon afterwards a great storm with heavy rain fell, and a great flood swept through the area.

original: Yasmiṁ padese bhagavā viharati, so padeso udakena na otthaṭo hoti.
analyzed: yasmin padese bhagavā viharati saḥ padesaḥ udakena na otthaṭaḥ hoti
translated: But the place where the Buddha was staying was not flooded.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: The Buddha thought,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ samantā udakaṁ ussāretvā majjhe reṇuhatāya bhūmiyā caṅkameyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham samantā udakam ussāretvā majjhe reṇu hatāya bhūmiyā caṅkameyyanti
translated: “Why don’t I raise the water all around and walk on dry ground in the middle?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā samantā udakaṁ ussāretvā majjhe reṇuhatāya bhūmiyā caṅkami.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā samantā udakam ussāretvā majjhe reṇu hatāya bhūmiyā caṅkami
translated: The Buddha then walked across the water to the dry ground in the middle.

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo—
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapaḥ jaṭilaḥ
translated: Uruvelā Kassapa thought,

original: “mā heva kho mahāsamaṇo udakena vūḷho ahosī”ti nāvāya sambahulehi jaṭilehi saddhiṁ yasmiṁ padese bhagavā viharati taṁ padesaṁ agamāsi.
analyzed: mā ha iva khalu mahā samaṇaḥ udakena vūḍhaḥ ahosi iti nāvāya sambahulehi jaṭilehi saddhim yasmin padese bhagavā viharati tam padesam agamāsi
translated: “The Great Ascetic is not drowned,” and he went with many ascetics in a boat to the place where the Buddha was staying.

original: Addasā kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavantaṁ samantā udakaṁ ussāretvā majjhe reṇuhatāya bhūmiyā caṅkamantaṁ, disvāna bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: addasā kho uruvelakassapaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavantam samantā udakam ussāretvā majjhe reṇu hatāya bhūmiyā disvāna bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He saw the Buddha walking across the water and said,

original: “idaṁ nu tvaṁ, mahāsamaṇā”ti?
analyzed: idam nu tva mahā samaṇa ati
translated: “Are you the one, Great Ascetic?”

original: “Ayamahamasmi, kassapā”ti
analyzed: ayam aham asmi kassapāti
translated: “It’s me,” replied the Buddha.

original: bhagavā vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā nāvāya paccuṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: bhagavā vehāsam abbhut gantvā nāvāya paccuṭṭhāsi
translated: He then rose up into the air and landed on the boat.

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: Uruvelā Kassapa thought,

original: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma udakampi na pavāhissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
analyzed: mahiddhikaḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ yatra hi nāma udakam pi na pavāhissati na tu eva ca kho arahā yathā
translated: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he’s not drowned, but he’s not a perfected one like me.”

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: The Buddha thought,

original: “cirampi kho imassa moghapurisassa evaṁ bhavissati—
analyzed: ciram pi kho imassa moghapurisassa evam bhavissati
translated: “This foolish man has been thinking like this for a long time:

original: ‘mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan’ti;
analyzed: mahiddhikaḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ na tu eva ca kho arahā yathā ahanti
translated: ‘The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, but he’s not a perfected one like me.’

original: yannūnāhaṁ imaṁ jaṭilaṁ saṁvejeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham imam jaṭilam
translated: Let me inspire him with confidence.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān uruvelakassapam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: He said to Uruvelā Kassapa,

original: “neva ca kho tvaṁ, kassapa, arahā, nāpi arahattamaggasamāpanno.
analyzed: na iva ca kho tva kassapa arahā na api arahatta magga samāpannaḥ
translated: “Kassapa, you’re not a perfected one, nor are you practicing to become one.

original: Sāpi te paṭipadā natthi, yāya tvaṁ arahā vā assasi, arahattamaggaṁ vā samāpanno”ti.
analyzed: sā api te paṭipadā natthi yāya tvam arahā vā assasi arahatta maggam vā samāpannaḥ ti
translated: You don’t have the path or the practice for becoming a perfected one.”

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu uruvelakassapaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Uruvelā Kassapa then bowed down with his head at the Buddha’s feet and said,

original: “labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyya āha bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti
translated: “Sir, may I receive the going forth in your presence? May I receive the full ordination?”

original: “Tvaṁ khosi, kassapa, pañcannaṁ jaṭilasatānaṁ nāyako vināyako aggo pamukho pāmokkho.
analyzed: tvam kho asi kassapa pañcannam jaṭila satānam nāyakaḥ vināyakaḥ aggaḥ pamukhaḥ pāmokkhaḥ
translated: “Kassapa, you’re the leader and guide of five hundred dreadlocked ascetics.

original: Tepi tāva apalokehi, yathā te maññissanti tathā te karissantī”ti.
analyzed: te pi tāva apalokehi yathā te maññissanti tathā te karissanti iti
translated: You should first get their permission, and then do as you think.”

original: Atha kho uruvelakassapo jaṭilo yena te jaṭilā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te jaṭile etadavoca—🔽“icchāmahaṁ, bho, mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ, yathā bhavanto maññanti tathā karontū”ti.
analyzed: atha kho uruvelakassapaḥ jaṭilaḥ yena te jaṭilā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te jaṭile etat avoca  icchāmaha bho mahā samaṇe brahmacariyam caritu yathā bhavantaḥ maññanti tathā karontu uti
translated: Uruvelakassapa then went to the other ascetics and said,🔽“I wish to practice the spiritual life under the Great Ascetic. Please do what you think it’s now time to do.”

original: “Cirapaṭikā mayaṁ, bho, mahāsamaṇe abhippasannā, sace bhavaṁ, mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṁ carissati, sabbeva mayaṁ mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyaṁ carissāmā”ti.
analyzed: cirapaṭikā bho mahāsamaṇe abhippasannā sace bhava mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyam carissati sabbe iva mayam mahāsamaṇe brahmacariyam carissāma ati
translated: “We’ve long had confidence in the Great Ascetic. If you practice the spiritual life under him, so will we.”

original: Atha kho te jaṭilā kesamissaṁ jaṭāmissaṁ khārikājamissaṁ aggihutamissaṁ udake pavāhetvā
analyzed: atha kho te jaṭilā kesa missam jaṭā missam khārikāja missam aggihuta missam udake pavāhetvā

original: yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—

translated: and they went to the Buddha. They bowed down with their heads at his feet, and said,

original: “labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyāma upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyyāma bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyāma upasampadanti
translated: “Venerable Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in his presence, we wish to receive the full ordination.”

original: “Etha bhikkhavo”ti bhagavā avoca—
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti bhagavā avoca
translated: “Come, monks!” the Buddha said.

original: “svākkhāto dhammo, caratha brahmacariyaṁ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ dhammaḥ caratha brahmacariyam sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati
translated: “The Dhamma is well-expounded. Practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

original: Sāva tesaṁ āyasmantānaṁ upasampadā ahosi.
analyzed: sā ava tesam āyasmantānam upasampadā ahosi
translated: And that was their full ordination.

translated: Nadīkassapa saw the hair, the topknot, the grass mat, and the fire equipment floating in the water, and he thought,

original: “mā heva me bhātuno upasaggo ahosī”ti.
analyzed: mā ha iva me bhātunaḥ upasaggo ahosi iti
translated: “I hope my brother hasn’t met with an accident.”

original: Jaṭile pāhesi—
analyzed: jaṭile pāhesi
translated: He sent the following message to the ascetics:

original: “gacchatha me bhātaraṁ jānāthā”ti.
analyzed: gacchatha me bhātaram jānātha ati
translated: “Go and find out about my brother.”

original: Sāmañca tīhi jaṭilasatehi saddhiṁ yenāyasmā uruvelakassapo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ uruvelakassapaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tīhi jaṭila satehi saddhim yena āyasman uruvelakassapaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam uruvelakassapam etat avoca
translated: Together with three hundred ascetics, he went to Uruvelā, to Uruvelā Kassapa, and said,

analyzed: idam nu kho kassapa seyyaḥ ti
translated: “Kassapa, is this better?”

original: “Āmāvuso, idaṁ seyyo”ti.
analyzed: ām āvuso idam seyyaḥ uti
translated: “Yes, it is.”

analyzed: atha kho te jaṭilā kesa missam jaṭā missam khārikāja missam aggihuta missam udake pavāhetvā

analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti bhagavā avoca

original: Sāva tesaṁ āyasmantānaṁ upasampadā ahosi.
analyzed: sā ava tesam āyasmantānam upasampadā ahosi
translated: And that was the full ordination of those venerables.

original: Addasā kho gayākassapo jaṭilo kesamissaṁ jaṭāmissaṁ khārikājamissaṁ aggihutamissaṁ udake vuyhamāne, disvānassa etadahosi—

translated: Gayākassapa saw his hair, his topknot, his bark garment, and his sacred fire being carried away by the water. He thought,

original: “mā heva me bhātūnaṁ upasaggo ahosī”ti.
analyzed: mā ha iva me bhātūnam upasaggaḥ ahosi iti
translated: “I hope my brothers haven’t drowned.”

original: Jaṭile pāhesi—
analyzed: jaṭile pāhesi
translated: He sent a message to the other two,

original: “gacchatha me bhātaro jānāthā”ti.
analyzed: gacchatha me bhātaraḥ jānātha ati
translated: “Please come and see if my brothers are all right.”

original: Sāmañca dvīhi jaṭilasatehi saddhiṁ yenāyasmā uruvelakassapo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ uruvelakassapaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: sāman ca dvīhi jaṭila satehi saddhim yena āyasmai uruvelakassapaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam uruvelakassapam etat avoca
translated: Together with two hundred of his own followers, he went to Uruvelakassapa, and said to him,

original: “idaṁ nu kho, kassapa, seyyo”ti?
analyzed: idam nu kho kassapa seyyaḥ ti
translated: “Is this better, Kassapa?”

original: “Āmāvuso, idaṁ seyyo”ti.🔽Atha kho te jaṭilā kesamissaṁ jaṭāmissaṁ khārikājamissaṁ aggihutamissaṁ udake pavāhetvā
analyzed: ām āvuso idam seyyaḥ uti  atha kho te jaṭilā kesa missam jaṭā missam khārikāja missam aggihuta missam udake pavāhetvā
translated: “Yes, it is.”

analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: They then threw their hair, topknots, staffs, and water pots into the water and went to the Buddha. They bowed down with their heads at his feet and said,
