analyzed: mañca paṭipādakā nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbā  kheḷa mallakaḥ nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.🔽He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

original: apassenaphalakaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;🔽bhūmattharaṇaṁ yathāpaññattaṁ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: a passena phalakam nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba 🔽bhūmattharaṇam yathāpaññattam sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba
translated: He should take out the ground covering and put it aside after considering where it was placed.

original: Sace vihāre santānakaṁ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṁ ohāretabbaṁ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.🔽Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṁ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace vihāre santānakam hoti ullokā paṭhamam ohāretabbaḥ āloka sandhi kaṇṇa bhāgā pamajjitabbā  sace geruka parikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti coḷakam temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā
translated: If there is a cobweb in the dwelling, he should first remove it with a palm-leaf fan or a cloth, and then dust the windows and the corners of the room.🔽If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they are moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

original: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṁ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace kāḷavaṇṇaka tā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti coḷakam temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā
translated: If the floor has been treated with cow dung and it is moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

original: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
analyzed: sace akatā hoti bhūmi udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā
translated: If the floor has not been treated with cow dung, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

original: mā vihāro rajena uhaññīti.
analyzed: mā vihāraḥ rajena uhaññī iti
translated: so that the dust does not fly up and settle on the furniture.

original: Saṅkāraṁ vicinitvā ekamantaṁ chaḍḍetabbaṁ.🔽Bhūmattharaṇaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
analyzed: saṅkāram vicinitvā ekamantam  bhūmattharaṇam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  mañca paṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā
translated: He should look for any trash and discard it.🔽He should sun the floor-cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back in, and lay it out as it was before.🔽He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back in, and place them as they were before.

original: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbo.
analyzed: mañcaḥ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabbaḥ
translated: He should sun the bed, clean it, beat it, lower it, bring it back in carefully without scraping it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, lay it out as it was before, and arrange the pillows.

original: Pīṭhaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pīṭham otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba
translated: After heating the bench, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should lower it and, without letting it crash down or make a loud noise, take it back and put it where it was before.

original: Bhisibibbohanaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
analyzed: bhisi bibbohanam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  nisīdana paccattharaṇam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  kheḷamallakaḥ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo
translated: After heating the spittoon, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.🔽After heating the sitting mat, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.🔽After heating the spittoon, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.

original: Apassenaphalakaṁ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: a passena phalakam otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabba
translated: After heating the leaning board, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: patta cīvaram
translated: He should put away the robe and bowl.

original: Pattaṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṁ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṁ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: pattam nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattam gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcam vā heṭṭhā pīṭham vā parāmasitvā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or under the bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: na ca anantara hitāya bhūmiyā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbo
translated: He should not put away the bowl on the bare ground.

original: Cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṁsaṁ vā cīvararajjuṁ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaram gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvara vasam vā cīvara rajjum vā pamajjitvā pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram nikkhipitabba
translated: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, feel under the bed or bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
analyzed: sace puratthimā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti puratthimā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace pacchimā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti pacchimā vāta pānā thaketabbā
translated: If the eastern side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the eastern windows should be closed.🔽If the western side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the western windows should be closed.

original: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṁ thaketabbā.
analyzed: sace uttarā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti uttarā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace dakkhiṇā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti dakkhiṇā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace sīta kālaḥ hoti divā vāta pānā vivaritabbā rattim thaketabbā
translated: If the northern side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the northern windows should be closed.🔽If the southern side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the southern windows should be closed.🔽If it’s cold, the windows should be closed during the day and opened at night.

original: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṁ vivaritabbā.🔽Sace pariveṇaṁ uklāpaṁ hoti, pariveṇaṁ sammajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace uṇha kālaḥ hoti divā vāta pānā thaketabbā rattim vivaritabbā  sace pariveṇam uklāpam hoti pariveṇam sammajjitabba
translated: If it’s hot, the windows should be closed at night and opened during the day.🔽If the surrounding area is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
analyzed: sace koṭṭhakaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti koṭṭhakaḥ sammajjitabbaḥ
translated: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.🔽Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace upaṭṭhāna sālā uklāpā hoti upaṭṭhāna sālā sammajjitabbā  sace aggi sālā uklāpā hoti aggi sālā sammajjitabbā
translated: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the fire hut is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.🔽Sace pānīyaṁ na hoti, pānīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā  sace pānīyam na hoti pānīyam upaṭṭhāpetabba
translated: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If there is no drinking water, he should set it out.

original: Sace paribhojanīyaṁ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace paribhojanīyam na hoti paribhojanīyam upaṭṭhāpetabba
translated: If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.

original: Sace ācamanakumbhiyaṁ udakaṁ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ āsiñcitabbaṁ.🔽Sace ācariyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, antevāsikena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace ācariyassa kukkuccaṁ uppannaṁ hoti, antevāsikena vinodetabbaṁ, vinodāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace ācamana kumbhiyam udakam na hoti ācamana kumbhiyā udakam  sace ācariyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti antevāsikena vūpakāsetabbaḥ vūpakāsāpetabbaḥ dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace ācariyassa kukkuccam uppannam hoti antevāsikena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should pour water into it.🔽If the teacher is discontent, the pupil should allay his discontent or get someone else to do so or give a Dhamma talk.🔽If the teacher is anxious, the pupil should dispel his anxiety or get someone else to do so or give a Dhamma talk.

original: Sace ācariyassa diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti, antevāsikena vivecetabbaṁ, vivecāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace ācariyassa diṭṭhi gatam uppannam hoti antevāsikena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If the teacher has wrong view, the pupil should make him give it up or get someone else to do so or give a Dhamma talk.

original: Sace ācariyo garudhammaṁ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ garu dhammam ajjhāpannaḥ hoti parivāsa arahaḥ antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation, the pupil should make an effort to get the Sangha to give it to him.🔽

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa parivāsaṁ dadeyyāti.🔽Sace ācariyo mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyassa parivāsam dadeyya ati  sace ācariyaḥ mūlāya paṭikassana arahaḥ hoti antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha grant my teacher probation?’

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṁ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.🔽Sace ācariyo mānattāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa mānattaṁ dadeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyam mūlāya paṭikasseyya ati  sace ācariyaḥ mānatta arahaḥ hoti antevāsikena ussukkam  kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyassa mānattam dadeyya ati
translated: If the teacher deserves to be sent back to the beginning, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha send him back to the beginning?’

original: Sace ācariyo abbhānāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—🔽kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṁ abbheyyāti.
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ hoti antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba  kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyam abbheyyāti
translated: If the teacher deserves the trial period, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha grant my teacher the trial period?’🔽If the teacher deserves rehabilitation, the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha rehabilitate my teacher?’🔽If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against the teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—the pupil should make an effort, ‘How can the Sangha not do that procedure,

original: Sace saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṁ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace saṅghaḥ ācariyassa kammam kattu kāmo hoti tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: or else change it to a lighter one?’

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṁ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ ācariyassa kammam na kareyya lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyya ati
translated: ‘How can the Sangha not do a legal procedure against my teacher, or else change it to a lighter one?’

original: Kataṁ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṁ, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: katam vā pana assa hoti saṅghena kamma tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā antevāsikena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the Sangha has done a legal procedure against him—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—the pupil should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho ācariyo sammā vatteyya, lomaṁ pāteyya, netthāraṁ vatteyya, saṅgho taṁ kammaṁ paṭippassambheyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyaḥ sammā vatteyya lomam pāteyya netthāram vatteyya saṅghaḥ tam kammam paṭippassambheyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can my teacher conduct himself properly, lower his hackles, mend his ways, so that the Sangha will lift that procedure?’

original: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ dhovitabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena dhovitabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa cīvaram dhovitabbam hoti antevāsikena dhovitabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher’s robe needs washing, the pupil should do it himself, or he should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṁ dhoviyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaram dhoviyetha ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can my teacher’s robe be washed?’

original: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ kātabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena kātabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa cīvaram kātabbam hoti antevāsikena kātabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher’s robe needs making, the pupil should do it himself, or he should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṁ kariyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaram kariyetha ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can my teacher’s robe be made?’

original: Sace ācariyassa rajanaṁ pacitabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena pacitabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa rajanam pacitabbam hoti antevāsikena pacitabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher’s dye needs boiling, the pupil should do it himself, or he should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho ācariyassa rajanaṁ paciyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyassa rajanam
translated: ‘How can I cook dye for my teacher?’

original: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ rajitabbaṁ hoti, antevāsikena rajitabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa cīvaram rajitabbam hoti antevāsikena rajitabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher’s robe needs to be dyed, the pupil should do the dyeing or make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṁ rajiyethāti.🔽Cīvaraṁ rajantena sādhukaṁ samparivattakaṁ samparivattakaṁ rajitabbaṁ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaram rajiyetha ati  cīvaram rajantena sādhukam samparivattakam samparivattakam rajitabba na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabba
translated: thinking, ‘How can my teacher’s robe be dyed?’🔽When dyeing a robe, he should carefully turn it end to end, and he shouldn’t leave while it’s still dripping.

original: Na ācariyaṁ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;🔽na ekaccassa cīvaraṁ dātabbaṁ;
analyzed: na ācariyam anāpucchā ekaccassa pattaḥ dātabbaḥ na ekaccassa pattaḥ paṭiggahetabbo  na ekaccassa cīvaram dātabba
translated: Without asking permission of his teacher, he shouldn’t give his bowl or robe to anyone else or receive them from anyone else;🔽he shouldn’t carry anything for anyone else or have it carried by anyone else;

original: na ekaccassa cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ;🔽na ekaccassa parikkhāro dātabbo;🔽na ekaccassa parikkhāro paṭiggahetabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa cīvaram  na ekaccassa parikkhāraḥ dātabbaḥ  na ekaccassa parikkhāraḥ paṭiggahetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t do any work for anyone else or have it done by anyone else;🔽he shouldn’t cut anyone’s hair or have his hair cut;

original: na ekaccassa kesā chedetabbā;🔽na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā;🔽na ekaccassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ;🔽na ekaccena parikammaṁ kārāpetabbaṁ;
analyzed: na ekaccassa kesā chedetabbā  na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā  na ekaccassa parikammam  na ekaccena parikammam
translated: he shouldn’t do a service for anyone else or have it done by anyone else;🔽he shouldn’t do a favor for anyone else or have it done by anyone else;

original: na ekaccassa veyyāvacco kātabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccassa veyyāvaccaḥ kātabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t do an errand for anyone else or have it done by anyone else;

original: na ekaccena veyyāvacco kārāpetabbo;🔽na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṁ;
analyzed: na ekaccena veyyāvaccaḥ kārāpetabbaḥ  na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena
translated: You shouldn’t do work for him.🔽You shouldn’t be his attendant monk.

original: na ekacco pacchāsamaṇo ādātabbo;🔽na ekaccassa piṇḍapāto nīharitabbo;
analyzed: na ekaccaḥ pacchā samaṇaḥ ādātabbaḥ  na ekaccassa piṇḍapātaḥ nīharitabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t accept being his attendant monk.🔽You shouldn’t bring back almsfood for him.

original: na ekaccena piṇḍapāto nīharāpetabbo.
analyzed: na ekaccena piṇḍapātaḥ nīharāpetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t have almsfood brought back for him.

original: Na ācariyaṁ anāpucchā gāmo pavisitabbo, na susānaṁ gantabbaṁ, na disā pakkamitabbā.
analyzed: na ācariyam an āpucchā gāmaḥ pavisitabbaḥ na su sānam gantabba na disā pakkamitabbā
translated: You shouldn’t enter the village without informing your teacher. You shouldn’t go to the charnel ground. You shouldn’t go wandering in the countryside.

original: Sace ācariyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṁ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabban”ti.
analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ gilānaḥ hoti yāvajīvam upaṭṭhātabbaḥ vuṭṭhānam assa āgametabbanti
translated: If your teacher is sick, you should nurse him for as long as he lives, or you should wait until he has recovered.”

original: Ācariyavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: ācariya vattam niṭṭhita
translated: The proper conduct toward a teacher is finished.

original: 19. Antevāsikavattakathā
analyzed: antevāsika vatta kathā
translated: The proper conduct for a pupil

original: “Ācariyena, bhikkhave, antevāsikamhi sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ācariyena bhikkhave antevāsikamhi sammā
translated: “A teacher should conduct himself properly toward his pupil.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā
translated: And this is the proper conduct:

original: Ācariyena, bhikkhave, antevāsiko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
analyzed: ācariyena bhikkhave antevāsikaḥ saṅgahetabbaḥ anuggahetabbaḥ uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā
translated: A teacher should support his pupil and look after him, instructing and teaching him.

original: Sace ācariyassa patto hoti, antevāsikassa patto na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa pattaḥ hoti antevāsikassa pattaḥ na hoti ācariyena antevāsikassa pattaḥ dātabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher has a bowl and the pupil doesn’t, the teacher should give the pupil the bowl, or he should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa pattaḥ uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my pupil get a bowl?’

original: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṁ hoti, antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ dātabbaṁ, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa cīvaram hoti antevāsikassa cīvaram na hoti ācariyena antevāsikassa cīvaram dātabba ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher has a robe but the pupil doesn’t, the teacher should give the pupil the robe or make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaram uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my pupil get a robe?’

original: Sace ācariyassa parikkhāro hoti, antevāsikassa parikkhāro na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace ācariyassa parikkhāraḥ hoti antevāsikassa parikkhāraḥ na hoti ācariyena antevāsikassa parikkhāraḥ dātabbaḥ ussukkam vā kātabba
translated: If the teacher has a requisite but the pupil doesn’t, the teacher should give the pupil the requisite or make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa parikkhāraḥ uppajjiyetha ati
translated: ‘How can my pupil get that requisite?’

original: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṁ dātabbaṁ, mukhodakaṁ dātabbaṁ, āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ gilānaḥ hoti kālassa iva uṭṭhāya danta kaṭṭham dātabba mukha udakam dātabba āsanam paññapetabba
translated: If the pupil is sick, the teacher should get up at the appropriate time, prepare a tooth cleaner, and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṁ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
analyzed: sace yāgu hoti bhājanam dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā
translated: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to the pupil.

original: Yāguṁ pītassa udakaṁ datvā bhājanaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: yāgum pītassa udakam datvā bhājanam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam a paṭigha santena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabba
translated: After the pupil has drunk the rice porridge, the teacher should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

original: Antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba
translated: When the pupil has gotten up, the bed and the chair should be put away.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo
translated: If the place is dirty, it should be swept.

original: Sace antevāsiko gāmaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, kāyabandhanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ gāmam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti nivāsanam dātabba paṭinivāsanam paṭiggahetabba kāya bandhanam dātabba sa guṇam katvā saṅghāṭiyaḥ dātabbā dhovitvā pattaḥ sa udakaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: If the pupil wants to enter the village, he should be given a sarong and a upper robe. The robes should be accepted after folding them and putting them together. The bowl should be given after washing it and drying it.

original: Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ
analyzed: ettāvatā nivattissati iti āsanam pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalika
translated: “He will return at this point,” the sitting mat should be laid out, water for washing the feet, a foot stool, and a foot scraper should be prepared.

original: upanikkhipitabbaṁ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ, paṭinivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ,
analyzed: upanikkhipitabba paccuggantvā patta cīvaram paṭiggahetabba paṭinivāsanam dātabba
translated: After going out to meet him, the bowl and robe should be received and the upper robe should be taken.

original: nivāsanaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: nivāsanam paṭiggahetabba
translated: The sarong should be received and put away.

original: Sace cīvaraṁ sinnaṁ hoti, muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbaṁ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṁ nidahitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace cīvaram sinnam hoti muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabba na ca uṇhe cīvaram nidahitabba
translated: If the robe is damp, it should be dried in the sun for a short time, but it should not be left in the sun for long.

original: Cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram
translated: The robe should be folded while supporting it with something.

original: Cīvaraṁ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṁ kaṇṇaṁ ussāretvā cīvaraṁ saṅgharitabbaṁ—
analyzed: cīvaram saṅgharantena catur aṅgulam kaṇṇam ussāretvā cīvaram
translated: When folding the robe, you should raise it up by four or five centimeters and then fold it,

original: mā majjhe bhaṅgo ahosīti.
analyzed: mā majjhe bhaṅgaḥ ahosi iti
translated: so that the hem does not get damaged in the middle.

original: Obhoge kāyabandhanaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: obhoge kāyabandhanam
translated: He should make a belt for the bowl bag out of the waistband.

original: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, antevāsiko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṁ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
analyzed: sace piṇḍapātaḥ hoti antevāsikaḥ ca bhuñjitu kāmaḥ hoti udakam datvā piṇḍapātaḥ upanāmetabbo
translated: If there is almsfood and if the pupil wants to eat, the preceptor should give him water and then the almsfood.

original: Antevāsiko pānīyena pucchitabbo.
analyzed: antevāsikaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo
translated: He should ask the pupil if he wants water to drink.

original: Bhuttāvissa udakaṁ datvā pattaṁ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena dhovitvā vodakaṁ katvā muhuttaṁ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
analyzed: bhuttāvissa udakam datvā pattam paṭiggahetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena dhovitvā vā udakam katvā muhuttam uṇhe otāpetabbaḥ na ca uṇhe pattaḥ nidahitabbaḥ
translated: After the meal, the preceptor should give the pupil water and receive the bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: patta cīvaram
translated: He should put away the robe and bowl.

original: Pattaṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṁ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṁ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: pattam nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattam gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcam vā heṭṭhā pīṭham vā parāmasitvā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or under the bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: na ca anantara hitāya bhūmiyā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbo
translated: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare ground.

original: Cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṁsaṁ vā cīvararajjuṁ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaram gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvara vasam vā cīvara rajjum vā pamajjitvā pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram nikkhipitabba
translated: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

original: Antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṁ uddharitabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ paṭisāmetabbaṁ.
analyzed: antevāsikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanam uddharitabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam paṭisāmetabba
translated: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

original: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.🔽Sace antevāsiko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.🔽Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace saḥ desaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti saḥ desaḥ sammajjitabbo  sace antevāsikaḥ nahāyitu kāmaḥ hoti nahānam  sace sītena atthaḥ hoti sītam
translated: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the pupil wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare a bath.🔽If he wants to take a hot bath, the teacher should light the heater, put stones in it, and heat water.

original: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṁ paṭiyādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace uṇhena atthaḥ hoti uṇham
translated: If he wants a cold bath, the teacher should have a servant fill the bathroom with water through a water pipe or by some other means.

original: Sace antevāsiko jantāgharaṁ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṁ sannetabbaṁ, mattikā temetabbā,
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ jantāgharam pavisitu kāmaḥ hoti cuṇṇam sannetabba mattikā temetabbā
translated: If the pupil wants to go to the sauna, the teacher should knead bath powder, moisten the clay,

original: jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṁ datvā cīvaraṁ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṁ
analyzed: jantāghara pīṭham ādāya gantvā jantāghara pīṭham da tvā cīvaram paṭiggahetvā ekamanta
translated: take a sauna bench, and go to the sauna. After giving the pupil the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside,

original: nikkhipitabbaṁ, cuṇṇaṁ dātabbaṁ, mattikā dātabbā.
analyzed: nikkhipitabba cuṇṇam dātabba mattikā dātabbā
translated: he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

original: Sace ussahati, jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace ussahati jantāgharam
translated: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

original: Jantāgharaṁ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṁ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṁ pavisitabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharam pavisantena mattikāya mukham makkhetvā puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharam pavisitabba
translated: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter the sauna.

original: Na ca there bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīditabbaṁ, na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā.
analyzed: na ca there bhikkhū an upakhajja nisīditabba na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā
translated: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks, nor should he block the junior monks from getting a seat.

original: Jantāghare antevāsikassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāghare antevāsikassa parikammam
translated: He should do services for his pupil in the sauna.

original: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṁ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāghara pīṭham ādāya puratas ca pacchatas ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabba
translated: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench and cover it in front and behind, and then leave.

original: Udakepi antevāsikassa parikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.🔽Nahātena paṭhamataraṁ uttaritvā attano gattaṁ vodakaṁ katvā nivāsetvā antevāsikassa
analyzed: udake pi antevāsikassa parikammam  nahātena paṭhamataram uttaritvā attanaḥ gattam vā udakam katvā nivāsetvā antevāsikassa
translated: He should do services for his pupil in the water.🔽When coming out of the water, he should be the first to get out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong.

original: gattato udakaṁ pamajjitabbaṁ, nivāsanaṁ dātabbaṁ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṁ
analyzed: udakam pamajjitabba nivāsanam dātabba saṅghāṭi dātabbā jantāghara pīṭha
translated: He should then wipe the water off his pupil’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench,

original: ādāya paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā āsanaṁ paññapetabbaṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ pādakathalikaṁ upanikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: ādāya paṭhamataram āgantvā āsanam paññapetabba pāda udakam pāda pīṭham pāda kathalikam upanikkhipitabba
translated: he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

original: Antevāsiko pānīyena pucchitabbo.
analyzed: antevāsikaḥ pānīyena pucchitabbo
translated: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.

original: Yasmiṁ vihāre antevāsiko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
analyzed: yasmin vihāre antevāsikaḥ viharati sace saḥ vihāraḥ uklāpaḥ hoti sace ussahati sodhetabbo
translated: If the dwelling where his pupil is staying is dirty, the preceptor should clean it if he’s able.

original: Vihāraṁ sodhentena paṭhamaṁ pattacīvaraṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;
analyzed: vihāram sodhentena paṭhamam patta cīvaram nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabba
translated: When cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robes and put them aside.

original: nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;🔽bhisibibbohanaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;🔽mañco nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbo;
analyzed: nisīdana paccattharaṇam nīharitvā ekamantam  bhisi bibbohanam nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba  mañcaḥ nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet for sitting on and put them aside.🔽He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.🔽He should lower the bed, be careful not to knock it against the door or the door frame, and take it out. He should put it aside.

original: pīṭhaṁ nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;
analyzed: pīṭham nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba
translated: He should lower the bench, be careful not to knock it against the door or the door frame, and take it out. He should put it aside.

original: mañcapaṭipādakā nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbā;🔽kheḷamallako nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbo;
analyzed: mañca paṭipādakā nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbā  kheḷa mallakaḥ nīharitvā eka mantam nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.🔽He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

original: apassenaphalakaṁ nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ;🔽bhūmattharaṇaṁ yathāpaññattaṁ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: a passena phalakam nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba 🔽bhūmattharaṇam yathāpaññattam sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantam nikkhipitabba
translated: He should take out the ground covering and put it aside after considering where it was placed.

original: Sace vihāre santānakaṁ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṁ otāretabbaṁ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.🔽Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṁ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace vihāre santānakam hoti ullokā paṭhamam otāretabbaḥ āloka sandhi kaṇṇa bhāgā pamajjitabbā  sace geruka parikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti coḷakam temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā
translated: If there is a cobweb in the dwelling, he should first remove it with a palm-leaf wiper or a cloth wiper.🔽If the wall has been treated with red ocher and has become moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the wall.

original: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṁ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace kāḷavaṇṇaka tā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti coḷakam temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā
translated: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and has become moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

original: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
analyzed: sace akatā hoti bhūmi udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā
translated: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

original: mā vihāro rajena uhaññīti.
analyzed: mā vihāraḥ rajena uhaññī iti
translated: making sure that he does not step on the area that has been sprinkled.

original: Saṅkāraṁ vicinitvā ekamantaṁ chaḍḍetabbaṁ.🔽Bhūmattharaṇaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
analyzed: saṅkāram vicinitvā ekamantam  bhūmattharaṇam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  mañca paṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā
translated: He should throw away any trash there.🔽He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back in, and put it back as before.🔽He should sun the supports for the bed, wipe them, bring them back in, and put them back as before.

original: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbo.
analyzed: mañcaḥ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabbaḥ
translated: He should sun the bed, clean it, beat it, lower it, carry it carefully without knocking it against the door or the doorposts or the walls, bring it back in, and put it back as before.

original: Pīṭhaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṁ katvā sādhukaṁ appaṭighaṁsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṁ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pīṭham otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcam katvā sādhukam appaṭigha santena a saṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭa piṭṭha atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba
translated: After heating the bench, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should lower it and, without letting it crash down or make a loud noise, take it back and put it where it was before.

original: Bhisibibbohanaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṁ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṁ paññapetabbaṁ.🔽Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
analyzed: bhisi bibbohanam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  nisīdana paccattharaṇam otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattam paññapetabba  kheḷamallakaḥ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo
translated: After heating the spittoon, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.🔽After heating the sitting mat, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.🔽After heating the spittoon, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.

original: Apassenaphalakaṁ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: a passena phalakam otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabba
translated: After heating the leaning board, wiping it, and shaking it out, he should take it back and put it where it was before.

original: Pattacīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: patta cīvaram
translated: He should put away the robe and bowl.

original: Pattaṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṁ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṁ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: pattam nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattam gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcam vā heṭṭhā pīṭham vā parāmasitvā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbaḥ
translated: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or under the bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
analyzed: na ca anantara hitāya bhūmiyā pattaḥ nikkhipitabbo
translated: He should not put away the bowl on the bare ground.

original: Cīvaraṁ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṁ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṁsaṁ vā cīvararajjuṁ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṁ orato bhogaṁ katvā cīvaraṁ nikkhipitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaram gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvara vasam vā cīvara rajjum vā pamajjitvā pāratas antam oratas bhogam katvā cīvaram nikkhipitabba
translated: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, feel under the bed or bench with the other, and then put it away.

original: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
analyzed: sace puratthimā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti puratthimā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace pacchimā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti pacchimā vāta pānā thaketabbā
translated: If the eastern side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the eastern windows should be closed.🔽If the western side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the western windows should be closed.

original: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.🔽Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṁ thaketabbā.
analyzed: sace uttarā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti uttarā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace dakkhiṇā sarajāḥ vātāḥ vāyanti dakkhiṇā vāta pānā thaketabbā  sace sīta kālaḥ hoti divā vāta pānā vivaritabbā rattim thaketabbā
translated: If the northern side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the northern windows should be closed.🔽If the southern side of the dwelling is exposed to the weather, the southern windows should be closed.🔽If it’s cold, the windows should be closed during the day and opened at night.

original: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṁ vivaritabbā.🔽Sace pariveṇaṁ uklāpaṁ hoti, pariveṇaṁ sammajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace uṇha kālaḥ hoti divā vāta pānā thaketabbā rattim vivaritabbā  sace pariveṇam uklāpam hoti pariveṇam sammajjitabba
translated: If it’s hot, the windows should be closed at night and opened during the day.🔽If the surrounding area is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
analyzed: sace koṭṭhakaḥ uklāpaḥ hoti koṭṭhakaḥ sammajjitabbaḥ
translated: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.🔽Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
analyzed: sace upaṭṭhāna sālā uklāpā hoti upaṭṭhāna sālā sammajjitabbā  sace aggi sālā uklāpā hoti aggi sālā sammajjitabbā
translated: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If the fire hut is dirty, he should sweep it.

original: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.🔽Sace pānīyaṁ na hoti, pānīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā  sace pānīyam na hoti pānīyam upaṭṭhāpetabba
translated: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.🔽If there is no drinking water, he should set it out.🔽If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.

original: Sace paribhojanīyaṁ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṁ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ.🔽Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṁ āsiñcitabbaṁ.🔽Sace antevāsikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, ācariyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.🔽Sace antevāsikassa kukkuccaṁ uppannaṁ hoti, ācariyena vinodetabbaṁ, vinodāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace paribhojanīyam na hoti paribhojanīyam upaṭṭhāpetabba  sace ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam na hoti ācamana kumbhiyāḥ udakam  sace antevāsikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti ācariyena vūpakāsetabbaḥ vūpakāsāpetabbaḥ dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā  sace antevāsikassa kukkuccam uppannam hoti ācariyena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should pour water into it.🔽If the pupil is discontent, the teacher should allay it or make an effort to have it allaid. If the pupil has wrong view, the teacher should make him give it up or make an effort to have it given up.🔽If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation, the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

original: Sace antevāsikassa diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti, ācariyena vivecetabbaṁ, vivecāpetabbaṁ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa diṭṭhi gatam uppannam hoti ācariyena dhamma kathā vā assa kātabbā
translated: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning, the teacher should try to get the Sangha to do it.🔽If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period, the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.🔽If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation, the teacher should try to get the Sangha to do it.

original: Sace antevāsiko garudhammaṁ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ garu dhammam ajjhāpannaḥ hoti parivāsa ārahaḥ ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation, the teacher should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho, antevāsikassa parivāsaṁ dadeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikassa parivāsam dadeyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha give my pupil probation?’

original: Sace antevāsiko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ mūlāya paṭikassana arahaḥ hoti ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil deserves to be sent back to the beginning, the teacher should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṁ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikam mūlāya paṭikasseyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha send my pupil back to the beginning?’

original: Sace antevāsiko mānattāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ mānatta arahaḥ hoti ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil deserves the trial period, the teacher should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa mānattaṁ dadeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikassa mānattam dadeyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha give my pupil the trial period?’

original: Sace antevāsiko abbhānāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ abbhāna arahaḥ hoti ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the pupil deserves rehabilitation, the teacher should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṁ abbheyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikam abbheyyāti
translated: thinking, ‘How can the Sangha rehabilitate my pupil?’

original: Sace saṅgho antevāsikassa kammaṁ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: sace saṅghaḥ antevāsikassa kammam kattu kāmaḥ hoti tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against the pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—the teacher should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa kammaṁ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho saṅghaḥ antevāsikassa kammam na kareyya lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyya ati
translated: ‘How can the Sangha not do a legal procedure against my pupil, or else change it to a lighter one?’

original: Kataṁ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṁ, tajjanīyaṁ vā niyassaṁ vā pabbājanīyaṁ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṁ vā ukkhepanīyaṁ vā, ācariyena ussukkaṁ kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: katam vā pana assa hoti saṅghena kamma tajjanīyam vā niyassam vā pabbājanīyam vā paṭisāraṇīyam vā ukkhepanīyam vā ācariyena ussukkam kātabba
translated: Or the Sangha has done a legal procedure against him— condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—the teacher should make an effort,

original: kinti nu kho antevāsiko sammā vatteyya, lomaṁ pāteyya, netthāraṁ vatteyya, saṅgho taṁ kammaṁ paṭippassambheyyāti.
analyzed: kinti nu kho antevāsikaḥ sammā vatteyya lomam pāteyya netthāram vatteyya saṅghaḥ tam kammam paṭippassambheyya ati
translated: thinking, ‘How can my pupil conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released?’

original: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ dhovitabbaṁ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—‘evaṁ dhoveyyāsī’ti,
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa cīvaram dhovitabbam hoti ācariyena ācikkhitabba evam dhoveyyāsi iti
translated: If the pupil’s robe needs washing, the teacher should show him how it’s done,

original: ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ dhoviyethāti.
analyzed: ussukkam vā nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaram
translated: or make an effort to find someone else to do it.

original: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ kātabbaṁ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—‘evaṁ kareyyāsī’ti,
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa cīvaram kātabbam hoti ācariyena ācikkhitabba evam kareyyāsi iti
translated: If the pupil needs a robe, the teacher should show him how to make one,

original: ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ kariyethāti.
analyzed: ussukkam vā nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaram kariyetha ati
translated: or make an effort to find someone else to do it.

original: Sace antevāsikassa rajanaṁ pacitabbaṁ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—‘evaṁ paceyyāsī’ti,
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa rajanam pacitabbam hoti ācariyena ācikkhitabba evam paceyyāsi iti
translated: If the student needs to make dye, the teacher should tell him, ‘Make the dye like this.’

original: ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa rajanaṁ paciyethāti.
analyzed: ussukkam vā nu kho antevāsikassa rajanam paciyetha ati
translated: Or he should make an effort, ‘How can my student make dye?’

original: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ rajitabbaṁ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṁ—‘evaṁ rajeyyāsī’ti,
analyzed: sace antevāsikassa cīvaram rajitabbam hoti ācariyena ācikkhitabba evam rajeyyāsi iti
translated: If the student needs to dye robes, the teacher should tell him, ‘Dye the robes like this.’

original: ussukkaṁ vā kātabbaṁ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṁ rajiyethāti.
analyzed: ussukkam vā nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaram rajiyetha ati
translated: Or he should make an effort, ‘How can my student dye robes?’

original: Cīvaraṁ rajantena sādhukaṁ samparivattakaṁ samparivattakaṁ rajitabbaṁ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: cīvaram rajantena sādhukam samparivattakam samparivattakam rajitabba na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabba
translated: When dyeing robes, he should do it carefully, turning the robe item frequently, and he shouldn’t leave while it is still dripping.

original: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṁ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabban”ti.
analyzed: sace antevāsikaḥ gilānaḥ hoti yāvajīvam upaṭṭhātabbaḥ vuṭṭhānam assa āgametabbanti
translated: If the student is sick, he should nurse him as long as he lives, or he should wait until he has recovered.”

original: Antevāsikavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: antevāsika vattam niṭṭhita
translated: The proper conduct toward a student is finished.

original: Chaṭṭho bhāṇavāro.
analyzed: chaṭṭhaḥ bhāṇavāro
translated: The sixth section for recitation is finished.

original: 20. Paṇāmanākhamāpanā
analyzed: paṇāmanā khamāpanā
translated: The sending away and the consenting

original: Tena kho pana samayena antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattanti …pe…
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena antevāsikāḥ ācariyesu na sammā vattanti pe
translated: At that time the students were not conducting themselves properly toward their teachers. …

original: bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: They told the Buddha. …🔽“A student should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.

original: “na, bhikkhave, antevāsikena ācariyamhi na sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave antevāsikena ācariyamhi na sammā vattitabba
translated: “You should behave properly toward your pupil.

original: Yo na sammā vatteyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ na sammā vatteyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Neva sammā vattanti.
analyzed: na iva sammā vattanti
translated: But they still didn’t behave properly.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: They told the Buddha. He said,

original: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, asammāvattantaṁ paṇāmetuṁ.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave a sammāvattantam paṇāmetu
translated: “You should dismiss a pupil who doesn’t behave properly.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, paṇāmetabbo—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: And this is how you should dismiss him:

original: paṇāmemi tanti vā, māyidha paṭikkamīti vā, nīhara te pattacīvaranti vā, nāhaṁ tayā upaṭṭhātabboti vā.
analyzed: paṇāmemi tat ti vā māyidha paṭikkamīti vā nīhara te patta cīvaranti vā na aham tayā upaṭṭhātabbā iti vā
translated: ‘I dismiss you,’ ‘Don’t come back here,’ ‘Get out,’ or ‘I don’t want to see you.’

original: Kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, paṇāmito hoti antevāsiko;
analyzed: kāyena viññāpeti vācāya viññāpeti kāyena vācāya viññāpeti paṇāmitaḥ hoti antevāsiko
translated: If you make him understand by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then he is dismissed.

original: na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na paṇāmito hoti antevāsiko”ti.
analyzed: na kāyena viññāpeti na vācāya viññāpeti na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti na paṇāmitaḥ hoti antevāsikaḥ ti
translated: If you don’t make him understand by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then he is not dismissed.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena antevāsikā paṇāmitā na khamāpenti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena antevāsikāḥ paṇāmitāḥ na khamāpenti
translated: On one occasion a pupil was dismissed, but he didn’t ask for forgiveness.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, khamāpetun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave khamāpetunti
translated: “You should ask for forgiveness.”

original: Neva khamāpenti.
analyzed: na iva khamāpenti
translated: But they still didn’t ask for forgiveness.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, paṇāmitena na khamāpetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave paṇāmitena na khamāpetabbaḥ
translated: “You should ask for forgiveness if you’ve been dismissed.

original: Yo na khamāpeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ na khamāpeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena ācariyā khamāpiyamānā na khamanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena ācariyā khamāpiyamānāḥ na khamanti
translated: On one occasion the teachers did not forgive when asked.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, khamitun”ti.🔽Neva khamanti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave khamitunti  na iva khamanti
translated: “You should forgive.”🔽But they still did not forgive.

original: Antevāsikā pakkamantipi vibbhamantipi titthiyesupi saṅkamanti.
analyzed: antevāsikā pakkamanti pi vibbhamanti pi titthiyesu pi saṅkamanti
translated: The pupils left, disrobed, and joined other religions.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, khamāpiyamānena na khamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave khamāpiyamānena na khamitabba
translated: “You should forgive when asked.

original: Yo na khameyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ na khameyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena ācariyā sammāvattantaṁ paṇāmenti, asammāvattantaṁ na paṇāmenti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena ācariyā sammāvattantam paṇāmenti a sammāvattantam na paṇāmenti
translated: On one occasion the teachers dismissed a pupil who was conducting himself properly, but not one who was not.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, sammāvattanto paṇāmetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave sammāvattantaḥ paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: “You should not dismiss a pupil who is conducting himself properly.

original: Yo paṇāmeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ paṇāmeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Na ca, bhikkhave, asammāvattanto na paṇāmetabbo.
analyzed: na ca bhikkhave a sammāvattantaḥ na paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: You should not dismiss a pupil who is not conducting himself properly.

original: Yo na paṇāmeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassāti.
analyzed: yaḥ na paṇāmeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If he doesn’t dismiss him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko paṇāmetabbo.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: “A pupil should be dismissed if he is devoid of five qualities:

original: Ācariyamhi nādhimattaṁ pemaṁ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
analyzed: na adhimattam pemam hoti na adhimattaḥ pasādaḥ hoti na adhimattā hirī hoti na adhimattaḥ gāravaḥ hoti na adhimattā bhāvanā hoti
translated: lacking in affection for his teacher; lacking in confidence in his teacher; lacking in conscience toward his teacher; lacking in respect for his teacher; lacking in development under his teacher.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko paṇāmetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: A pupil should be dismissed if he is devoid of these five qualities.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko na paṇāmetabbo.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ na paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: “A pupil should not be dismissed if he is endowed with five qualities:

original: Ācariyamhi adhimattaṁ pemaṁ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
analyzed: ācariyamhi adhimattam pemam hoti adhimattaḥ pasādaḥ hoti adhimattā hirī hoti adhimattaḥ gāravaḥ hoti adhimattā bhāvanā hoti
translated: having much affection for his teacher; having much confidence in his teacher; having much conscience toward his teacher; having much respect for his teacher; having much development under his teacher.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko na paṇāmetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ na paṇāmetabbaḥ
translated: A pupil should not be dismissed if he is endowed with these five qualities.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko alaṁ paṇāmetuṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ alam paṇāmetu
translated: “A pupil may dismiss his teacher if he is endowed with five qualities:

original: Ācariyamhi nādhimattaṁ pemaṁ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
analyzed: na adhimattam pemam hoti na adhimattaḥ pasādaḥ hoti na adhimattā hirī hoti na adhimattaḥ gāravaḥ hoti na adhimattā bhāvanā hoti
translated: He doesn’t have much affection for his teacher, respect, conscience, or devotion, and he hasn’t developed his mind much.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko alaṁ paṇāmetuṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ alam paṇāmetu
translated: A pupil who has these five qualities is ready to be dismissed.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko nālaṁ paṇāmetuṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ na alam paṇāmetu
translated: A pupil who has five qualities is not ready to be dismissed.

original: Ācariyamhi adhimattaṁ pemaṁ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
analyzed: ācariyamhi adhimattam pemam hoti adhimattaḥ pasādaḥ hoti adhimattā hirī hoti adhimattaḥ gāravaḥ hoti adhimattā bhāvanā hoti
translated: He has much affection for his teacher, respect, conscience, and devotion, and he has developed his mind much.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato antevāsiko nālaṁ paṇāmetuṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgataḥ antevāsikaḥ na alam paṇāmetu
translated: A pupil who has these five qualities is not ready to be dismissed.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ antevāsikaṁ appaṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, paṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam antevāsikam appaṇāmentaḥ ācariyo sa atisāraḥ hoti paṇāmentaḥ anatisāraḥ hoti
translated: If a pupil has five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him, but not if he does.

original: Ācariyamhi nādhimattaṁ pemaṁ hoti, nādhimatto pasādo hoti, nādhimattā hirī hoti, nādhimatto gāravo hoti, nādhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
analyzed: na adhimattam pemam hoti na adhimattaḥ pasādaḥ hoti na adhimattā hirī hoti na adhimattaḥ gāravaḥ hoti na adhimattā bhāvanā hoti
translated: He doesn’t have much affection for his teacher, respect, conscience, or devotion, and he hasn’t developed his mind.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṁ antevāsikaṁ appaṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, paṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgatam antevāsikam appaṇāmentaḥ ācariyo sa atisāraḥ hoti paṇāmentaḥ anatisāraḥ hoti
translated: If a pupil has these five qualities, the teacher is at fault for not dismissing him, but not if he dismisses him.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ antevāsikaṁ paṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, appaṇāmento anatisāro hoti.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam antevāsikam paṇāmentaḥ ācariyo sa atisāraḥ hoti a paṇāmentaḥ anatisāraḥ hoti
translated: If a pupil has five qualities, the teacher is at fault for dismissing him, but not if he doesn’t dismiss him.

original: Ācariyamhi adhimattaṁ pemaṁ hoti, adhimatto pasādo hoti, adhimattā hirī hoti, adhimatto gāravo hoti, adhimattā bhāvanā hoti—
analyzed: ācariyamhi adhimattam pemam hoti adhimattaḥ pasādaḥ hoti adhimattā hirī hoti adhimattaḥ gāravaḥ hoti adhimattā bhāvanā hoti
translated: He has much affection for his teacher, respect, conscience, and devotion, and he has developed his mind.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṁ antevāsikaṁ paṇāmento ācariyo sātisāro hoti, appaṇāmento anatisāro hotī”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgatam antevāsikam paṇāmentaḥ ācariyo sa atisāraḥ hoti a paṇāmentaḥ anatisāraḥ hoti iti
translated: If a pupil has these five qualities, the teacher is at fault for dismissing him, but not if he doesn’t dismiss him.”

original: Paṇāmanā khamāpanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṇāmanā khamāpanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The section for recitation on dismissal and forgiveness is finished.

original: 21. Bālaabyattavatthu
analyzed: bāla a byatta vatthu
translated: The case of the foolish man

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū, dasavassamhā dasavassamhāti, bālā abyattā nissayaṁ denti.🔽Dissanti ācariyā bālā, antevāsikā paṇḍitā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dasa vassamhā dasa vassamhā ati bālāḥ abyattāḥ nissayam denti  dissanti ācariyā bālā antevāsikā paṇḍitā
translated: At that time there were ignorant and incompetent monks who gave formal support to other monks, saying, “I’ve ten years of seniority” or “I’ve ten years of seniority.”

original: Dissanti ācariyā abyattā, antevāsikā byattā.🔽Dissanti ācariyā appassutā, antevāsikā bahussutā.
analyzed: dissanti ācariyāḥ abyattāḥ antevāsikā byattā  dissanti ācariyāḥ appassutāḥ antevāsikāḥ bahussutā
translated: There were ignorant teachers with knowledgeable students,🔽incompetent teachers with competent students,🔽unlearned teachers with learned students,

original: Dissanti ācariyā duppaññā, antevāsikā paññavanto.
analyzed: dissanti ācariyāḥ duppaññāḥ antevāsikā paññavanto
translated: and witless teachers with intelligent students.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū—dasavassamhā dasavassamhāti—bālā abyattā nissayaṁ dassanti.🔽Dissanti ācariyā bālā antevāsikā paṇḍitā, dissanti ācariyā abyattā antevāsikā byattā,
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhikkhū dasa vassamhāḥ dasa vassamhā ati bālāḥ abyattāḥ nissayam dassanti  dissanti ācariyāḥ bālāḥ antevāsikā paṇḍitāḥ dissanti ācariyāḥ abyattāḥ antevāsikā byattā
translated: “How can ignorant and incompetent monks give formal support to other monks, saying, ‘I’ve ten years of seniority’ or ‘I’ve ten years of seniority’?

original: dissanti ācariyā appassutā antevāsikā bahussutā, dissanti ācariyā duppaññā antevāsikā paññavanto”ti.
analyzed: dissanti ācariyāḥ appassutāḥ antevāsikāḥ bahu ssutāḥ dissanti ācariyāḥ duppaññāḥ antevāsikā paññavanto ti
translated: There are ignorant teachers with knowledgeable students, incompetent teachers with competent students, unlearned teachers with learned students, and witless teachers with intelligent students.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū—
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave bhikkhū
translated: “Is it true, monks, that monks

original: dasavassamhā dasavassamhāti—
analyzed: dasa vassamhā dasa vassamhā iti
translated: ‘Ten years,’ ‘ten years,’

original: bālā abyattā nissayaṁ denti …pe…
analyzed: bālāḥ abyattāḥ nissayam denti pe
translated: immature and incompetent monks gave formal support. …

original: “saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “Is it true, monks, that this was said?”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: after rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “na, bhikkhave, bālena abyattena nissayo dātabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave bālena abyattena nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: “You should not give formal support to an immature monk.

original: Yo dadeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ dadeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena dasavassena vā atirekadasavassena vā nissayaṁ dātun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena dasa vassena vā atireka dasa vassena vā nissayam dātunti
translated: I allow a competent and capable monk who has ten or more years of seniority to give formal support.”

original: Bālaabyattavatthu niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: bāla abyatta vatthu
translated: The sub-chapter on the immature and the incompetent is finished.

original: 22. Nissayapaṭippassaddhikathā
analyzed: nissaya paṭippassaddhi kathā
translated: . The discussion of the ending of formal support

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ācariyupajjhāyesu pakkantesupi vibbhantesupi kālaṅkatesupi pakkhasaṅkantesupi nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo na jānanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ācariya upajjhāyesu pakkantesu pi vibbhantesu pi kālaṅkatesu pi pakkha saṅkantesu pi nissaya paṭippassaddhiyaḥ na jānanti
translated: At that time the monks did not know whether to end their formal support when their teachers or preceptors had left the monastic life, gone over to another faction, or died.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Pañcimā, bhikkhave, nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo upajjhāyamhā—
analyzed: pañcimāḥ bhikkhave nissaya paṭippassaddhiyaḥ
translated: “Monks, there are five reasons for ending your formal support with your preceptor:

original: upajjhāyo pakkanto vā hoti, vibbhanto vā, kālaṅkato vā, pakkhasaṅkanto vā, āṇattiyeva pañcamī.
analyzed: upajjhāyaḥ pakkantaḥ vā hoti vibbhantaḥ vā kālaṅkataḥ vā pakkha saṅkantaḥ vā āṇattiyā iva pañcamī
translated: his preceptor has left the monastery; his preceptor has died; his preceptor has disrobed; his preceptor has joined another faction; the preceptor has given him permission.

original: Imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo upajjhāyamhā.
analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave pañca nissaya paṭippassaddhiyaḥ
translated: These are the five reasons the formal support of a preceptor ends.

original: Chayimā, bhikkhave, nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo ācariyamhā—
analyzed: chayimāḥ bhikkhave nissaya paṭippassaddhiyaḥ
translated: There are six reasons the formal support of a teacher ends:

original: ācariyo pakkanto vā hoti, vibbhanto vā, kālaṅkato vā, pakkhasaṅkanto vā, āṇattiyeva pañcamī, upajjhāyena vā samodhānagato hoti.
analyzed: ācariyo pakkantaḥ vā hoti vibbhantaḥ vā kālaṅkataḥ vā pakkha saṅkantaḥ vā āṇattiyā iva pañcamī upajjhāyena vā samodhāna gataḥ hoti
translated: his teacher has left the monastery; his teacher has died; his teacher has disrobed; his teacher has joined another faction; the teacher has given him permission; he has been reconciled with his preceptor.

original: Imā kho, bhikkhave, cha nissayapaṭippassaddhiyo ācariyamhā.
analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave cha nissaya paṭippassaddhiyaḥ
translated: These are the six reasons the formal support of a teacher ends.

original: Nissayapaṭippassaddhikathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nissaya paṭippassaddhi kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the ending of formal support is finished.

original: 23. Upasampādetabbapañcaka
translated: . The group of five on the full ordination

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṁ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabba na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: “A monk who has five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

original: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato
analyzed: na asekkhena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena samannāgataḥ
translated: He’s not perfected in morality; he’s not perfected in conduct; he’s not perfected in view; he’s not perfected in livelihood;

original: hoti, na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena
analyzed: hoti na asekkhena paññā kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena
translated: he does not possess the aggregate of wisdom of one beyond training, he does not possess the aggregate of freedom of one beyond training,

original: samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: he doesn’t have the wisdom of one beyond training; he doesn’t have the freedom of one beyond training; he doesn’t have the knowledge and vision of freedom of one beyond training.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṁ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabba na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.🔽Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato🔽hoti, asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbo sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo  asekkhena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena samannāgataḥ  hoti asekkhena paññā kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena samannāgataḥ
translated: A monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

original: hoti, asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: hoti asekkhena vimutti ñāṇa dassana khandhena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: he has the virtue of one beyond training; he has the concentration of one beyond training; he has the wisdom of one beyond training; he has the freedom of one beyond training; he has the knowledge and vision of freedom of one beyond training.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbo sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo
translated: “Endowed with these five qualities, a monk may give the full ordination, may give formal support, may have a novice monk attend on him, and may accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṁ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabba na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: “Endowed with five other qualities, a monk should not give the full ordination, should not give formal support, should not have a novice monk attend on him, and may not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

original: Attanā na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṁ asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: attanā na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na param asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā
translated: “He himself is not endowed with the aggregate of virtue of one beyond training; he does not lead others in the aggregate of virtue of one beyond training;

original: attanā na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṁ asekkhe samādhikkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: attanā na asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na param asekkhe samādhi kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: “He himself is not endowed with the aggregate of concentration of one beyond training; he does not lead others in the aggregate of concentration of one beyond training;

original: attanā na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṁ asekkhe paññākkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: attanā na asekkhena paññā kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na param asekkhe paññā kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: “He himself is not endowed with the aggregate of discernment of one beyond training; he does not lead others in the aggregate of discernment of one beyond training;

original: attanā na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṁ asekkhe vimuttikkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: attanā na asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na param asekkhe vimutti kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: “He himself is not endowed with the aggregate of release of one beyond training; he does not lead others in the aggregate of release of one beyond training;

original: attanā na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na paraṁ asekkhe vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhe samādapetā—
analyzed: attanā na asekkhena vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na param asekkhe vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: he is not without the knowledge and vision of freedom that is noble and transcendent, and he does not encourage others in such knowledge and vision.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṁ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabba na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has these five qualities should not give the full ordination, should not give formal support, and a novice should not be made to attend to him.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.🔽Attanā asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṁ asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā;🔽attanā asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṁ asekkhe samādhikkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbo sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo  attanā asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti param asekkhe sīlakkhandhe samādapetā  attanā asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti param asekkhe samādhi kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: A monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, may give formal support, and a novice may be made to attend to him.🔽He is accomplished in virtue himself and encourages others in virtue;🔽he is accomplished in concentration himself and encourages others in concentration;

original: attanā asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṁ asekkhe paññākkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: attanā asekkhena paññā kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti param asekkhe paññā kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: he is accomplished in discernment himself and encourages others in discernment;

original: attanā asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, paraṁ asekkhe vimuttikkhandhe samādapetā;
analyzed: attanā asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti param asekkhe vimutti kkhandhe samādapetā
translated: He himself is endowed with the aggregate of virtue of one beyond training. He inspires others to take up the aggregate of virtue of one beyond training.🔽He himself is endowed with the aggregate of concentration of one beyond training. He inspires others to take up the aggregate of concentration of one beyond training.🔽He himself is endowed with the aggregate of discernment of one beyond training. He inspires others to take up the aggregate of discernment of one beyond training.🔽He himself is endowed with the aggregate of release of one beyond training. He inspires others to take up the aggregate of release of one beyond training.
