translated: A monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

original: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṁ vā saddhivihāriṁ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṁ🔽ādibrahmacariyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṁ, abhidhamme vinetuṁ, abhivinaye vinetuṁ, uppannaṁ
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti antevāsim vā saddhivihārim vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetu  ādibrahmacariyakāya sikkhāya vinetu abhidhamme vinetu abhivinaye vinetu uppanna
translated: He’s capable of instructing the student or the pupil and making him train in the basics of the monastic life,

original: diṭṭhigataṁ dhammato vivecetuṁ, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
analyzed: diṭṭhigatam dhammataḥ vivecetu dasa vassaḥ vā hoti atireka dasa vassaḥ vā
translated: to guide in the higher virtue, to guide in the higher mind, to guide in the higher wisdom, to resolve his uncertainties about the Teaching, and he has ten or more years of seniority.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbo sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo
translated: A monk who has these six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṁ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabba na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has six other qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

original: Āpattiṁ na jānāti, anāpattiṁ na jānāti, lahukaṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti, garukaṁ āpattiṁ🔽na jānāti, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena na svāgatāni honti na suvibhattāni
analyzed: āpattim na jānāti anāpattim na jānāti lahukam āpattim na jānāti garukam āpatti  na jānāti ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena na svāgatāni honti na su vibhattāni
translated: He doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy;

original: na suppavattīni na suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, ūnadasavasso hoti—
analyzed: na su pavattīni na su vinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso ūna dasa vassaḥ hoti
translated: he hasn’t properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail, including the introduction, the introduction in brief, the detailed Monastic Code, the summary of the training rules, the chapter on offenses, and the chapter on undetermined offenses; he has less than ten years of seniority.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṁ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabba na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: A monk who has these six qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.”

original: Chahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: chahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbo sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo
translated: A monk who has six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him:

original: Āpattiṁ jānāti, anāpattiṁ jānāti, lahukaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, garukaṁ āpattiṁ jānāti,🔽ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni
analyzed: āpattim jānāti anāpattim jānāti lahukam āpattim jānāti garukam āpattim jānāti  ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti su vibhattāni su pavattīni
translated: he knows what is an offense; he knows what is not an offense; he knows what is a light offense; he knows what is a heavy offense;

original: suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
analyzed: su vinicchitāni dasa vassaḥ vā hoti atireka dasa vassaḥ vā
translated: both Monastic Codes are familiar to him in detail, both in their introduction in their recitation, in their wording, and in their analysis; he has ten or more years of seniority.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave chahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbo sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo ti
translated: A monk who has these six qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.”

original: Upasampādetabbachakkacuddasavāro niṭṭhito.
analyzed: upasampādetabba chakka cuddasa vāraḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The fourteenth section on “worthy of the full ordination” is finished.

original: 25. Aññatitthiyapubbakathā
analyzed: añña titthiya pubba kathā
translated: The account of those who have been monastics of another religion

original: Tena kho pana samayena yo so aññatitthiyapubbo upajjhāyena sahadhammikaṁ vuccamāno upajjhāyassa vādaṁ āropetvā taṁyeva titthāyatanaṁ saṅkami.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena yaḥ saḥ añña titthiya pubbaḥ upajjhāyena sahadhammikam vuccamānaḥ upajjhāyassa vādam āropetvā tayā iva tittha āyatanam saṅkami
translated: At that time a monk who had been a monastic of another religion was arguing with the monks. When the monks corrected him in accordance with the Teaching, he contradicted them. He then left to join that same religious community.

original: So puna paccāgantvā bhikkhū upasampadaṁ yāci.
analyzed: so puna paccāgantvā bhikkhū upasampadam yāci
translated: He returned and asked the monks for the full ordination.

original: Bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhū bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: The monks told the Buddha.

original: “Yo so, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo upajjhāyena sahadhammikaṁ vuccamāno upajjhāyassa vādaṁ āropetvā taṁyeva titthāyatanaṁ saṅkanto, so āgato na upasampādetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ upajjhāyena sahadhammikam vuccamānaḥ upajjhāyassa vādam āropetvā tayā iva tittha āyatanam saṅkanto saḥ āgataḥ na upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: “Monks, when a person who has been a monastic of another religion argues with his preceptor and returns to that same religious community, he shouldn’t be given the full ordination.

original: Yo so, bhikkhave, aññopi aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṁ, tassa cattāro māse parivāso dātabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ bhikkhave aññaḥ api añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajje ākaṅkhati upasampadā tassa cattāraḥ māse parivāsaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: But if anyone else who has been a monastic of another religion wants the going forth and the full ordination in this Dhamma and Discipline, he should be given four months of probation.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, dātabbo—🔽paṭhamaṁ kesamassuṁ ohārāpetvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādāpetvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave dātabbaḥ  paṭhamam kesa massum ohārāpetvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādāpetvā ekasam uttarāsaṅga
translated: And, monks, this is how he should be given probation:🔽First he should be made to shave off his hair and beard, put on ocher robes, and cover his right shoulder.

original: kārāpetvā bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vandāpetvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīdāpetvā añjaliṁ paggaṇhāpetvā🔽‘evaṁ vadehī’ti vattabbo—
analyzed: kārāpetvā bhikkhūnam pāde vandāpetvā ukkuṭikam nisīdāpetvā añjalim paggaṇhāpetvā  evam vadehi iti vattabbaḥ
translated: He should then bow down at the feet of the monks, sit in the kneeling position with his hands respectfully folded,

original: ‘Buddhaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: buddham saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: and say, ‘I go for refuge to the Buddha,

original: Dhammaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: dhammam saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: I go for refuge to the Teaching,

original: Saṅghaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi.
analyzed: saṅgham saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: I go for refuge to the Sangha.

original: Dutiyampi buddhaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: dutiyam pi buddham saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: For a second time I go to the Buddha for refuge,

original: Dutiyampi dhammaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: dutiyam pi dhammam saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: For a second time I go to the Teaching for refuge,

original: Dutiyampi saṅghaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi.🔽Tatiyampi buddhaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: dutiyam pi saṅgham saraṇam gacchāmi  tatiyam pi buddham saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: For a second time I go to the Sangha for refuge.🔽For a third time I go to the Buddha for refuge,

original: Tatiyampi dhammaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: tatiyam pi dhammam saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: For a third time I go to the Teaching for refuge,

original: Tatiyampi saṅghaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmī’ti.
analyzed: saṅgham saraṇam gacchāmi iti
translated: For a third time I go to the Sangha for refuge.’

original: Tena, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbena saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—🔽‘ahaṁ, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhāmi upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbena saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ  aha bhante añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhāmi upasampadā
translated: Then that person who was previously a monastic of another religion should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, saṅghaṁ cattāro māse parivāsaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: sā uha bhante saṅgham cattāraḥ māse parivāsam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbo
translated: ‘Venerables, I was previously a monastic of another religion. I ask the Sangha for probation for four months.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbaḥ
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhati upasampadā
translated: This person so-and-so, who was formerly of another religion, wishes for Acceptance in this Dhamma-Vinaya.

original: So saṅghaṁ cattāro māse parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham cattāraḥ māse parivāsam yācati
translated: He is asking the Saṅgha for probation for four months.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ saṅgho itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāsaṁ dadeyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa patta kallam saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa añña titthiya pubbassa cattāraḥ māse parivāsam dadeyya
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready, it should give probation for four months to so-and-so, who was formerly of another religion.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerable sirs, let the Saṅgha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhati upasampadā
translated: This person so-and-so, who was formerly of another religion, wishes for Acceptance in this Dhamma-Vinaya.

original: So saṅghaṁ cattāro māse parivāsaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ saṅgham cattāraḥ māse parivāsam yācati
translated: He is asking the Saṅgha for probation for four months.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāsaṁ deti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa añña titthiya pubbassa cattāraḥ māse parivāsam deti
translated: The Saṅgha is giving probation for four months to so-and-so, who was formerly of another religion.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāsassa dānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa añña titthiya pubbassa cattāraḥ māse parivāsassa so tuṇhassa
translated: If the granting of probation for four months to so-and-so, who was formerly of another religion, is agreeable to the venerable ones, they should be silent;

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: he to whom it is not agreeable, he should speak.

original: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmassa aññatitthiyapubbassa cattāro māse parivāso.
analyzed: dinnaḥ saṅghena itthannāmassa añña titthiya pubbassa cattāraḥ māse parivāsaḥ
translated: Probation for four months has been granted by the Saṅgha to so-and-so, who was formerly of another religion.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti, evaṁ anārādhako.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti evam an ārādhakaḥ
translated: This is how a person who was previously a monastic of another religion succeeds and fails.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ anārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: And how does a person who was previously a monastic of another religion fail?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo atikālena gāmaṁ pavisati, atidivā paṭikkamati.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ atikālena gāmam pavisati atidivā paṭikkamati
translated: It may be that a person who was previously a monastic of another religion enters the village too early and returns too late in the day.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ anārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: In this way a person who was previously a monastic of another religion fails.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo vesiyāgocaro vā hoti, vidhavāgocaro vā hoti, thullakumārikāgocaro vā hoti, paṇḍakagocaro vā hoti, bhikkhunigocaro vā hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ vesiyā gocaraḥ vā hoti vidhavā gocaraḥ vā hoti thullakumārikā gocaraḥ vā hoti paṇḍaka gocaraḥ vā hoti bhikkhuni gocaraḥ vā hoti
translated: It may be that a person who was previously a monastic of another religion associates with sex workers, widows, single women, paṇḍakas, or nuns.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ anārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: In this way a person who was previously a monastic of another religion fails.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṁ uccāvacāni karaṇīyāni,
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnam uccāvacāni karaṇīyāni
translated: It may be that a person who was previously a monastic of another religion doesn’t do the various duties of the monastic life,

original: tattha na dakkho hoti, na analaso, na tatrupāyāya vīmaṁsāya samannāgato, na alaṁ🔽kātuṁ, na alaṁ saṁvidhātuṁ.
analyzed: tattha na dakkhaḥ hoti na analasaḥ na tatrupāyāya vīmasāya samannāgataḥ na  kātu na alam savidhātu
translated: he is not skilled, not diligent, not endowed with the ability to investigate and scrutinize that matter. He is not able to do it, not up to it.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ anārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: In this way, monks, one who was previously of another sect is not successful.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo na tibbacchando hoti uddese, paripucchāya, adhisīle, adhicitte, adhipaññāya.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ na tibba chandaḥ hoti uddese paripucchāya adhi sīle adhi citte adhi paññāya
translated: “Again, monks, one who was previously of another sect is not one who has strong desire to learn the recitation, to learn the questions, in higher virtue, in higher mind, in higher wisdom.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yassa titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ anārādhakaḥ hoti  puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ yassa tittha āyatanā saṅkantaḥ hoti tassa
translated: In this way, monks, one who was previously of another sect is not successful.🔽“Again, monks, one who was previously of another sect is one who has gone forth from the home life into homelessness in this Dhamma and Discipline because of his conviction,

original: satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa avaṇṇe bhaññamāne
analyzed: satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa avaṇṇe bhaññamāne
translated: but when the Teacher or a teacher’s equal criticizes his former sect,🔽he is angry and displeased, and he does not approve;

original: kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho, buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā avaṇṇe
analyzed: kupitaḥ hoti an atta manaḥ an abhiraddhaḥ buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā a vaṇṇe
translated: but when the Teacher or a teacher’s equal criticizes the Buddha, the Dhamma, or the Saṅgha,

original: bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho.
analyzed: bhaññamāne atta manaḥ hoti udaggaḥ abhiraddhaḥ
translated: he is pleased, uplifted, and delighted.

original: Yassa vā pana titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā🔽tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho, buddhassa
analyzed: yassa vā pana tittha āyatanā saṅkantaḥ hoti tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā  tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne atta manaḥ hoti udaggaḥ abhiraddhaḥ buddhassa
translated: Or he is one who has gone over to this sect from another, and when the Teacher or the Dhamma or the Sangha is being praised,

original: vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho.
analyzed: vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupitaḥ hoti an atta manaḥ an abhiraddho
translated: he is pleased, elated, and delighted, but when the Teacher or the Dhamma or the Sangha is being criticized, he is displeased, dejected, and disgusted.

original: Idaṁ, bhikkhave, saṅghātanikaṁ aññatitthiyapubbassa anārādhanīyasmiṁ.🔽Evampi kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo anārādhako hoti.
analyzed: idam bhikkhave saṅghātanikam añña titthiya pubbassa an ārādhanīyasmi  evam pi kho bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ anārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: This is the kind of person from another sect who should not be given the Going-forth.🔽This is how a person from another sect is not a suitable candidate.

original: Evaṁ anārādhako kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo āgato na upasampādetabbo.
analyzed: evam an ārādhakaḥ kho bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ āgataḥ na upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: A person from another sect who is not a suitable candidate should not be given the Going-forth.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a person from another sect a suitable candidate?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo nātikālena gāmaṁ pavisati nātidivā paṭikkamati.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ na ati kālena gāmam pavisati na ati divā paṭikkamati
translated: It’s when a person from another sect doesn’t enter the village too early or return too late in the day.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: This is how a person from another sect is a suitable candidate.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo na vesiyāgocaro hoti, na vidhavāgocaro hoti, na thullakumārikāgocaro hoti, na paṇḍakagocaro hoti, na bhikkhunigocaro hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ na vesiyā gocaraḥ hoti na vidhavā gocaro hoti na thullakumārikā gocaraḥ hoti na paṇḍaka gocaraḥ hoti na bhikkhuni gocaraḥ hoti
translated: “Again, an individual who has gone forth from another religion does not frequent courtesans, does not frequent widows, does not frequent paṇḍakas, does not frequent bhikkhunīs.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṁ uccāvacāni karaṇīyāni,
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti  puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnam uccāvacāni karaṇīyāni
translated: In this way, too, an individual who has gone forth from another religion is one who succeeds.

original: tattha dakkho hoti, analaso, tatrupāyāya vīmaṁsāya samannāgato, alaṁ kātuṁ, alaṁ saṁvidhātuṁ.
analyzed: tattha dakkhaḥ hoti analasaḥ tatrupāyāya vīmasāya samannāgataḥ alam kātu alam savidhātu
translated: “Again, an individual who has gone forth from another religion is skillful and diligent in attending to the various duties connected with the dwelling place, and he is one who ponders the methods, the sphere, and the right time for doing things.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: In this way, too, an individual who has gone forth from another religion is one who succeeds.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo tibbacchando hoti uddese, paripucchāya, adhisīle, adhicitte, adhipaññāya.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ tibba chandaḥ hoti uddese paripucchāya adhi sīle adhi citte adhi paññāya
translated: “Again, an individual who has gone forth from another religion is one who has strong desire to learn, strong desire for the training, and strong desire for the pursuit of the practice.

original: Evampi, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: In this way, too, an individual who has gone forth from another religion is one who succeeds.”

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo yassa titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ yassa tittha āyatanā saṅkantaḥ hoti tassa
translated: Again, when the good qualities, the special qualities of the teacher of another sect are being spoken of,

original: satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa avaṇṇe bhaññamāne
analyzed: satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa avaṇṇe bhaññamāne
translated: he is pleased, he approves, he is satisfied, he is happy, he is pleased in mind, he rejoices.

original: attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho, buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā avaṇṇe bhaññamāne
analyzed: atta manaḥ hoti udaggaḥ abhiraddhaḥ buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā avaṇṇe bhaññamāne
translated: But when the good qualities, the special qualities of the Buddha, the Dhamma, or the Saṅgha are being spoken of,

original: kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho.🔽Yassa vā pana titthāyatanā saṅkanto hoti, tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā
analyzed: kupitaḥ hoti an atta manaḥ an abhiraddhaḥ  yassa vā pana tittha āyatanā saṅkantaḥ hoti tassa satthuno tassa diṭṭhiyā tassa khantiyā
translated: he is displeased, dissatisfied, he does not rejoice, he is unhappy, he is downcast in mind.

original: tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupito hoti anattamano anabhiraddho,
analyzed: tassa ruciyā tassa ādāyassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne kupitaḥ hoti an atta manaḥ an abhiraddhaḥ
translated: Or when the good qualities, the special qualities of the teacher of another sect are being spoken of, he is displeased, dissatisfied, he does not rejoice, he is unhappy, he is downcast in mind.

original: buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attamano hoti udaggo abhiraddho.🔽Idaṁ, bhikkhave, saṅghātanikaṁ aññatitthiyapubbassa ārādhanīyasmiṁ.
analyzed: buddhassa vā dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇe bhaññamāne atta manaḥ hoti udaggaḥ abhiraddho  idam bhikkhave saṅghātanikam añña titthiya pubbassa ārādhanīyasmi
translated: But when the good qualities, the special qualities of the Buddha, the Dhamma, or the Saṅgha are being spoken of,🔽he is pleased, he approves, he is satisfied, he is happy, he is pleased in mind, he rejoices.🔽This is the way in which a person who has previously been a monastic of another religion is pleasing to one who has gone forth in this Dhamma and discipline.

original: Evampi kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo ārādhako hoti.
analyzed: evam pi kho bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: In this way, too, a person who has previously been a monastic of another religion is pleasing to one who has gone forth in this Dhamma and discipline.

original: Evaṁ ārādhako kho, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo āgato upasampādetabbo.
analyzed: evam ārādhakaḥ kho bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ āgataḥ upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: That’s how you should give the full ordination to anyone who has been a monastic of another religion and who has completed his probationary period.

original: Sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyapubbo naggo āgacchati, upajjhāyamūlakaṁ cīvaraṁ pariyesitabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace bhikkhave añña titthiya pubbaḥ naggaḥ āgacchati upajjhāya mūlakam cīvaram pariyesitabba
translated: If he comes naked, you should search for a robe from your own requisites.

original: Sace acchinnakeso āgacchati, saṅgho apaloketabbo bhaṇḍukammāya.
analyzed: sace a chinna kesaḥ āgacchati saṅghaḥ apaloketabbaḥ bhaṇḍu kammāya
translated: If he comes with uncut hair and beard, you should ask the Sangha for a ceremony to shave his head.

original: Ye te, bhikkhave, aggikā jaṭilakā, te āgatā upasampādetabbā, na tesaṁ parivāso dātabbo.
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave aggikāḥ jaṭilakā te āgatāḥ upasampādetabbāḥ na tesam parivāsaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: But if he’s a fire-worshiper or a dreadlocked ascetic, he should be given the full ordination right away, and he shouldn’t be made to do the probationary training.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Kammavādino ete, bhikkhave, kiriyavādino.
analyzed: kamma vādinaḥ ete bhikkhave kiriya vādinaḥ
translated: Because they believe in deeds and in the performance of deeds.

original: Sace, bhikkhave, jātiyā sākiyo aññatitthiyapubbo āgacchati, so āgato upasampādetabbo, na tassa parivāso dātabbo.
analyzed: sace bhikkhave jātiyā sākiyaḥ añña titthiya pubbo āgacchati saḥ āgataḥ upasampādetabbaḥ na tassa parivāsaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: If anyone who has been a monastic of another religion and who is a Sakyan by birth comes, he should be given the full ordination right away, and he shouldn’t be made to do the probationary training.

original: Imāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ñātīnaṁ āveṇikaṁ parihāraṁ dammī”ti.
analyzed: imā aha bhikkhave ñātīnam āveṇikam parihāram dammi iti
translated: I give this special privilege to my relatives.”

original: Aññatitthiyapubbakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: añña titthiya pubba kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of those who have been monastics of another religion is finished.

original: Sattamo bhāṇavāro.🔽26. Pañcābādhavatthu
analyzed: sattamaḥ bhāṇa vāro  pañca ābādha vatthu
translated: The seventh section for recitation is finished.🔽The five grounds for a charge of sickliness

original: Tena kho pana samayena magadhesu pañca ābādhā ussannā honti—
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena magadhesu pañca ābādhāḥ ussannāḥ honti
translated: At that time in Magadha there were five sicknesses that were prevalent,

original: kuṭṭhaṁ, gaṇḍo, kilāso, soso, apamāro.
analyzed: kuṭṭha gaṇḍo kilāsaḥ sosaḥ apamāraḥ
translated: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, and epilepsy.

original: Manussā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhā jīvakaṁ komārabhaccaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadanti—
analyzed: manussā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhāḥ jīvakam komārabhaccam upasaṅkamitvā evam vadanti
translated: When people were afflicted with these five diseases, they went to Jīvaka Komārabhacca and said,

original: “sādhu no, ācariya, tikicchāhī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu naḥ ācariya tikicchāhi iti
translated: “It would be good, teacher, if you would treat us.”

original: “Ahaṁ khvayyo, bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo;
analyzed: aham khvayyaḥ bahu kiccaḥ bahu karaṇīyaḥ
translated: “I’m very busy, sirs.

original: rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho;
analyzed: rājā ca me māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgāram ca buddha ppamukhaḥ ca bhikkhu saṅgho
translated: I have to look after King Bimbisāra of Magadha and his harem, and the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: nāhaṁ sakkomi tikicchitun”ti.
analyzed: na aham sakkomi tikicchitun ti
translated: I’m not able to treat you.”

original: “Sabbaṁ sāpateyyañca te, ācariya, hotu;🔽mayañca te dāsā;
analyzed: sabbam sāpateyyam ca te ācariya hotu  mayan ca te dāsā
translated: “All our wealth will be yours, teacher,🔽and we’ll be your slaves.

original: sādhu, no, ācariya, tikicchāhī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu naḥ ācariya tikicchāhi iti
translated: Please treat us.”

original: “Ahaṁ khvayyo, bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho;
analyzed: aham khvayyaḥ bahu kiccaḥ bahu karaṇīyaḥ rājā ca me māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgāram ca buddha ppamukhaḥ ca bhikkhu saṅgho
translated: “I’m very busy, sirs. I have to look after King Bimbisāra of Magadha and his harem, and the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: nāhaṁ sakkomi tikicchitun”ti.
analyzed: na aham sakkomi tikicchitun ti
translated: I’m not able to treat you.”

original: Atha kho tesaṁ manussānaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho tesam manussānam etat ahosi
translated: Then those people thought,

original: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
analyzed: ime kho samaṇā sakya puttiyā sukha sīlā sukha samācārā su bhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti
translated: “These Sakyan monastics are easy to live with and easy to associate with. They eat good food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyāma.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyāma
translated: Why don’t we go forth with them?

original: Tattha bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahissanti, jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchissatī”ti.🔽Atha kho te manussā bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṁ yāciṁsu.
analyzed: tattha bhikkhū ca iva upaṭṭhahissanti jīvakaḥ ca komāra bhacco tikicchissati iti  atha kho te manussāḥ bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjam yācisu
translated: The monks will look after us, and Jīvaka Komārabhacca will treat us.”🔽They then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

original: Te bhikkhū pabbājesuṁ, upasampādesuṁ.
analyzed: te bhikkhū pabbājesu upasampādesu
translated: The monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

original: Te bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahiṁsu jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchi.
analyzed: te bhikkhū ca iva upaṭṭhahisu jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchi
translated: The monks looked after them, and Jīvaka Komārabhacca treated them.🔽On that occasion there were many sick monks who were being looked after by other monks.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bahū gilāne bhikkhū upaṭṭhahantā yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharanti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bahū gilāne bhikkhū upaṭṭhahantā yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharanti
translated: They were constantly asking for things:

original: “gilānabhattaṁ detha, gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṁ detha, gilānabhesajjaṁ dethā”ti.
analyzed: gilāna bhattam detha gilāna upaṭṭhāka bhattam detha gilāna bhesajjam detha ati
translated: “Give a meal for the sick, a meal for those who nurse the sick, medicine for the sick.”

original: Jīvakopi komārabhacco bahū gilāne bhikkhū tikicchanto aññataraṁ rājakiccaṁ parihāpesi.
analyzed: jīvakaḥ api komārabhaccaḥ bahū gilāne bhikkhū tikicchantaḥ aññataram rāja kiccam parihāpesi
translated: And because Jīvaka Komārabhacca was treating so many sick monks, he neglected his royal duties.

original: Aññataropi puriso pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭho jīvakaṁ komārabhaccaṁ upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
analyzed: aññataraḥ api puriso pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhaḥ jīvakam komāra bhaccam upasaṅkamitvā etat avoca
translated: A certain man who was sick with the five diseases went to Jīvaka Komārabhacca and said,

original: “sādhu maṁ, ācariya, tikicchāhī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me ācariya tikicchāhi iti
translated: “Please treat me, teacher.”

original: “Ahaṁ khvayyo, bahukicco, bahukaraṇīyo, rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho;
analyzed: aham khvayyaḥ bahu kiccaḥ bahu karaṇīyaḥ rājā ca me māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgāram ca buddha ppamukhaḥ ca bhikkhu saṅgho
translated: “I’m very busy, sir. I have to treat King Bimbisāra and his harem, and the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: nāhaṁ sakkomi tikicchitun”ti.
analyzed: na aham sakkomi tikicchitun ti
translated: I can’t treat you.”

original: “Sabbaṁ sāpateyyañca te, ācariya, hotu, ahañca te dāso;
analyzed: sabbam sāpateyyam ca te ācariya hotu aham ca te dāsaḥ
translated: “I’ll give you all my wealth, teacher, and I’ll be your slave.

original: sādhu maṁ, ācariya, tikicchāhī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me ācariya tikicchāhi iti
translated: Please treat me.”🔽“I’m very busy, sir. I have to treat King Bimbisāra and his harem, and the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: “Ahaṁ khvayyo, bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo, rājā ca me māgadho seniyo bimbisāro upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgārañca buddhappamukho ca bhikkhusaṅgho, nāhaṁ sakkomi tikicchitun”ti.
analyzed: aham khvayyaḥ bahu kiccaḥ bahu karaṇīyaḥ rājā ca me māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ upaṭṭhātabbo itthāgāram ca buddha ppamukhaḥ ca bhikkhu saṅgho na aham sakkomi tikicchitunti
translated: I can’t treat you.”

original: Atha kho tassa purisassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho tassa purisassa etat ahosi
translated: The man thought,

original: “ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
analyzed: ime kho samaṇā sakya puttiyā sukha sīlā sukha samācārā su bhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti
translated: “The Sakyan monastics are easy to live with and easy to please. They eat good food and sleep in the windless interior.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyyaṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya
translated: “Why don’t I go forth with the Sakyan monastics?

original: Tattha bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahissanti, jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchissati.
analyzed: tattha bhikkhū ca iva upaṭṭhahissanti jīvakaḥ ca komāra bhacco tikicchissati
translated: There the monks will nurse me, and Jīvaka Komārabhacca will treat me.

original: Somhi arogo vibbhamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: somhi arogaḥ vibbhamissāmi iti
translated: When I’m healthy, I’ll disrobe.”

original: Atha kho so puriso bhikkhu upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṁ yāci.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ purisaḥ bhikkhu upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjam yāci
translated: He then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

original: Taṁ bhikkhū pabbājesuṁ, upasampādesuṁ.
analyzed: tam bhikkhū pabbājesu upasampādesu
translated: The monks gave him the going forth and the full ordination.

original: Taṁ bhikkhū ceva upaṭṭhahiṁsu, jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchi.
analyzed: tam bhikkhū ca iva upaṭṭhahisu jīvako ca komārabhacco tikicchi
translated: The monks nursed him, and Jīvaka Komārabhacca treated him.

original: So arogo vibbhami.
analyzed: saḥ arogaḥ vibbhami
translated: When he was healthy, he disrobed.

original: Addasā kho jīvako komārabhacco taṁ purisaṁ vibbhantaṁ, disvāna taṁ purisaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: addasā kho jīvakaḥ komāra bhaccaḥ tam purisam disvāna tam purisam etat avoca
translated: Jīvaka Komārabhacca saw him disrobed and said to him,

original: “nanu tvaṁ, ayyo, bhikkhūsu pabbajito ahosī”ti?
analyzed: nanu tva ayyaḥ bhikkhūsu pabbajitaḥ ahosi iti
translated: “Sir, didn’t you go forth with the monks?”

original: “Evaṁ, ācariyā”ti.
analyzed: eva ācariyāti
translated: “Yes, teacher.”

original: “Kissa pana tvaṁ, ayyo, evarūpamakāsī”ti?🔽Atha kho so puriso jīvakassa komārabhaccassa etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: kissa pana tva ayyaḥ evarūpam akāsi iti  atha kho saḥ purisaḥ jīvakassa komārabhaccassa etam attham ārocesi
translated: “But why did you do that?”🔽The man told him what had happened.

original: Jīvako komārabhacco ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
analyzed: jīvakaḥ komāra bhaccaḥ ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti
translated: Jīvaka complained and criticized the monks,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhaṁ pabbājessantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhadantā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭham pabbājessanti iti
translated: “How could the venerables give the going forth to someone who has five diseases?”🔽Jīvaka Komārabhacca then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Atha kho jīvako komārabhacco yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho jīvako komārabhacco bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu jīvakaḥ komārabhaccaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu jīvakaḥ komārabhaccaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and told him what had happened.

original: “sādhu, bhante, ayyā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭhaṁ na pabbājeyyun”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante ayyā pañcahi ābādhehi phuṭṭham na pabbājeyyunti
translated: “It would be good, Venerable Sir, if the Buddha would prevent the monks from giving the going forth to people with five diseases.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā jīvakaṁ komārabhaccaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā jīvakam komāra bhaccam dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

original: Atha kho jīvako komārabhacco bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.

analyzed: katham hi nāma samaṇā sakya puttiyā lakkhaṇa āhatam kata daṇḍa kammam pabbājessanti iti
translated: “How can the Sakyan monastics give the going forth to someone who has been marked with a sign and branded?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, lakkhaṇāhato katadaṇḍakammo pabbājetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave lakkhaṇa āhataḥ kata daṇḍa kammaḥ pabbājetabbaḥ
translated: “You should not give the going forth to someone who has been marked with a sign and branded.

original: Yo pabbājeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pabbājeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 33. Iṇāyikavatthu
analyzed: iṇāyika vatthu
translated: The case of the one who had been a debtor

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso iṇāyiko palāyitvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ purisaḥ iṇāyikaḥ palāyitvā bhikkhūsu pabbajitaḥ hoti
translated: At that time a man who owed money ran away and went forth as a monk.

original: Dhaniyā passitvā evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: dhaniyā passitvā evam āhasu
translated: When his creditors saw him, they said,

original: “ayaṁ so amhākaṁ iṇāyiko.
analyzed: ayam saḥ amhākam iṇāyikaḥ
translated: “That’s the man who owes us money.

original: Handa naṁ nemā”ti.
analyzed: handa nam nema ati
translated: Let’s arrest him.”

original: Ekacce evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: ekacce evam ahasu
translated: Some said,

original: “māyyo, evaṁ avacuttha.
analyzed: evam avacuttha
translated: “Don’t say that.

original: Anuññātaṁ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena—
analyzed: anuññātam raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena
translated: King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha has given permission

original: ‘ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṁ;
analyzed: ye samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti na te labbhā kiñci kātu
translated: that no one should do anything to those who have gone forth among the Sakyan monastics.

original: svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṁ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ dhammaḥ carantu brahmacariyam sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati
translated: The Teaching is well-proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life for making a complete end of suffering.”

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized those monks,

original: “abhayūvarā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā.
analyzed: ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā

original: Nayime labbhā kiñci kātuṁ.
analyzed: na ime labbhā kiñci kātu
translated: No one can do anything to them.

original: Kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā iṇāyikaṁ pabbājessantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma samaṇāḥ sakyaputtiyāḥ iṇāyikam pabbājessanti iti
translated: How can they give the going forth to someone who owes money?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, iṇāyiko pabbājetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave iṇāyikaḥ pabbājetabbaḥ
translated: “You should not give the going forth to someone who owes money.

original: Yo pabbājeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pabbājeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 34. Dāsavatthu
analyzed: dāsavatthu
translated: The story of the slave

translated: At that time a certain slave had gone forth with the monks.

analyzed: ayyakā passitvā evam āhasu
translated: When his owners saw him, they said,

original: “ayaṁ so amhākaṁ dāso.
analyzed: ayam saḥ amhākam dāsaḥ
translated: “That’s our slave.

original: Handa naṁ nemā”ti.
analyzed: handa nam nema ati
translated: Let’s take him back.”

original: Ekacce evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: ekacce evam ahasu
translated: Some said,

original: “māyyo, evaṁ avacuttha, anuññātaṁ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena ‘ye samaṇesu🔽sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti, na te labbhā kiñci kātuṁ, svākkhāto dhammo, carantu brahmacariyaṁ
analyzed: evam avacuttha anuññātam raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena ye samaṇesu  sakyaputtiyesu pabbajanti na te labbhā kiñci kātu su ākkhātaḥ dhammo carantu
translated: “Don’t say that. King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha has given permission for anyone who goes forth with the Sakyan monastics to be left in peace.

original: sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati
translated: The Teaching is well proclaimed. They practice the spiritual life to make a complete end of suffering.”

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized them,

analyzed: ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na yime labbhā kiñci kātu
translated: “These Sakyan monastics are beyond the law. They can’t be made to do anything.

original: Kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dāsaṁ pabbājessantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma samaṇāḥ sakyaputtiyāḥ dāsam pabbājessanti iti
translated: How can they give the going forth to a slave?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, dāso pabbājetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave dāsaḥ pabbājetabbaḥ
translated: “You should not give the going forth to a slave.

analyzed: yaḥ pabbājeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 35. Kammārabhaṇḍuvatthu
analyzed: kammārabhaṇḍuvatthu
translated: The account of Kammāra’s son

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro kammārabhaṇḍu mātāpitūhi saddhiṁ bhaṇḍitvā ārāmaṁ gantvā bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ kammārabhaṇḍu mātā pitūhi saddhim bhaṇḍitvā ārāmam gantvā bhikkhūsu pabbajitaḥ hoti
translated: At that time a certain young man had quarreled with his parents and had gone to the monastery and gone forth as a monk.

original: Atha kho tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātāpitaro taṁ kammārabhaṇḍuṁ vicinantā ārāmaṁ gantvā bhikkhū pucchiṁsu—
analyzed: atha kho tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātā pitaraḥ tam kammārabhaṇḍum vicinantāḥ ārāmam gantvā bhikkhū pucchisu
translated: His parents went to the monastery looking for him and asked the monks,

original: “api, bhante, evarūpaṁ dārakaṁ passeyyāthā”ti?
analyzed: api bhante evarūpam dārakam passeyyātha ati
translated: “Venerables, have you seen a boy like this?”

original: Bhikkhū ajānaṁyeva āhaṁsu—
analyzed: bhikkhū ajānayā iva āhasu
translated: Not knowing, the monks said,

original: “na jānāmā”ti, apassaṁyeva āhaṁsu—
analyzed: na jānāma ati apassayā iva āhasu
translated: “We don’t know.” Not seeing, they said,

original: “na passāmā”ti.
analyzed: na passāma ati
translated: “We haven’t seen him.”

original: Atha kho tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātāpitaro taṁ kammārabhaṇḍuṁ vicinantā bhikkhūsu pabbajitaṁ disvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: atha kho tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātā pitaraḥ tam kammārabhaṇḍum vicinantāḥ bhikkhūsu pabbajitam disvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: When his parents found him, they complained and criticized the monks,

original: “alajjino ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā, dussīlā musāvādino.
analyzed: alajjinaḥ ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ dussīlāḥ musā vādinaḥ
translated: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and have no sense of decency.

original: Jānaṁyeva āhaṁsu—‘na jānāmā’ti, passaṁyeva āhaṁsu—‘na passāmā’ti.
analyzed: jānayā iva āhasuna jānāma ati passayā iva āhasuna passāma ati
translated: They know, but say they don’t know, and they see, but say they don’t see.

original: Ayaṁ dārako bhikkhūsu pabbajito”ti.
analyzed: ayam dārako bhikkhūsu pabbajitaḥ ti
translated: This boy has gone forth as a monk.”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātāpitūnaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tassa kammārabhaṇḍussa mātā pitūnam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentānam
translated: The parents of the smith’s apprentice complained and criticized him,

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: The monks heard the complaints of the parents of the smith’s apprentice.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghaṁ apaloketuṁ bhaṇḍukammāyā”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave saṅgham apaloketum bhaṇḍu kammāya ati
translated: “Monks, I allow you to ask the Sangha for permission to do smith’s work.”

original: 36. Upālidārakavatthu
analyzed: upāli dāraka vatthu
translated: The story of the boy Upāli

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe sattarasavaggiyā dārakā sahāyakā honti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena rājagahe satta rasa vaggiyāḥ dārakāḥ sahāyakāḥ honti
translated: At that time in Rājagaha there were seventeen boys who were friends.

original: Upālidārako tesaṁ pāmokkho hoti.
analyzed: upāli dārako tesam pāmokkhaḥ hoti
translated: Upāli was the most prominent of them.

original: Atha kho upālissa mātāpitūnaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then Upāli’s parents thought,

original: “kena nu kho upāyena upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti?
analyzed: kena nu khalu upāyena upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: “By what means can Upāli live happily after we’re gone, without working too hard?”

original: Atha kho upālissa mātāpitūnaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then they thought,

original: “sace kho upāli lekhaṁ sikkheyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli lekham sikkheyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: “If Upāli learns to write, he’ll be able to live happily after we’re gone, without working too hard.”

original: Atha kho upālissa mātāpitūnaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then they thought,

original: “sace kho upāli lekhaṁ sikkhissati, aṅguliyo dukkhā bhavissanti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli lekham sikkhissati aṅguliyaḥ dukkhāḥ bhavissanti
translated: “If he learns to write, his fingers will hurt.

original: Sace kho upāli gaṇanaṁ sikkheyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli gaṇanam sikkheyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: If he learns to count, he’ll be able to live comfortably after we’re gone, without having to work hard.”

original: Atha kho upālissa mātāpitūnaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: His parents said,

original: “sace kho upāli gaṇanaṁ sikkhissati, urassa dukkho bhavissati.
analyzed: sace kho upāli gaṇanam sikkhissati urassa dukkhaḥ bhavissati
translated: “If he learns to count, his chest will hurt.

original: Sace kho upāli rūpaṁ sikkheyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli rūpam sikkheyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: If he learns to read, he’ll be able to live comfortably after we’re gone, without having to work hard.”

original: Atha kho upālissa mātāpitūnaṁ etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: His parents said,

original: “sace kho upāli rūpaṁ sikkhissati, akkhīni dukkhā bhavissanti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli rūpam sikkhissati akkhīni dukkhā bhavissanti
translated: “If he learns to read, his eyes will hurt.

original: Ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā, subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
analyzed: ime kho samaṇā sakya puttiyā sukha sīlā sukha samācārā su bhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti
translated: But these Sakyan monastics have a pleasant spiritual life. They eat nice food and sleep in the windless interior of buildings.

original: Sace kho upāli samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: If Upāli were to go forth with the Sakyan monastics, he would be able to live comfortably and without difficulty after our passing.”

original: Assosi kho upālidārako mātāpitūnaṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho upāli dārakaḥ mātā pitūnam imam kathā sallāpa
translated: The young Upāli overheard this conversation between his parents.

original: Atha kho upālidārako yena te dārakā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te dārake etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu upāli dārakaḥ yena te dārakā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te dārake etat avoca
translated: He then went to the other boys and said,

original: “etha mayaṁ, ayyā, samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajissāmā”ti.
analyzed: etha maya ayyā samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajissāma ati
translated: “Come, sirs, let’s go forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

original: “Sace kho tvaṁ, ayya, pabbajissasi, evaṁ mayampi pabbajissāmā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho tva ayya pabbajissasi evam mayam pi pabbajissāma ati
translated: “If you go forth, we’ll go forth too.”

original: Atha kho te dārakā ekamekassa mātāpitaro upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho te dārakāḥ ekam ekassa mātā pitaraḥ upasaṅkamitvā etat avocuḥ
translated: Each of them then went to their parents and said,

original: “anujānātha maṁ agārasmā anāgāriyaṁ pabbajjāyā”ti.
analyzed: anujānātha mama agārasmai anāgāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “Please give me permission to go forth from the household life into homelessness.”

original: Atha kho tesaṁ dārakānaṁ mātāpitaro—
analyzed: atha khalu tesam dārakānam mātā pitaraḥ
translated: Their parents thought,

original: “sabbepime dārakā samānacchandā kalyāṇādhippāyā”ti—🔽anujāniṁsu.🔽Te bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṁ yāciṁsu.
analyzed: sabbe pi ime dārakā samāna chandā kalyāṇa adhippāyā ati  anujānisu  te bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjam yācisu
translated: “All these boys have the same wish and the same intention.”🔽And they gave their permission.🔽They then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

original: Te bhikkhū pabbājesuṁ upasampādesuṁ.
analyzed: te bhikkhū pabbājesum upasampādesu
translated: The monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

original: Te rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya rodanti—
analyzed: te rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya rodanti
translated: In the morning they got up and cried,

original: “yāguṁ detha, bhattaṁ detha, khādanīyaṁ dethā”ti.
analyzed: yāgum detha bhattam detha khādanīyam detha ati
translated: “Give us rice porridge! Give us a meal! Give us fresh food!”

original: Bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: The monks said,

original: “āgametha, āvuso, yāva ratti vibhāyati.
analyzed: āgametha āvuso yāva ratti vibhāyati
translated: “Wait, Venerables, until it’s light.

original: Sace yāgu bhavissati pivissatha, sace bhattaṁ bhavissati bhuñjissatha, sace khādanīyaṁ bhavissati khādissatha;
analyzed: sace yāgu bhavissati pivissatha sace bhattam bhavissati bhuñjissatha sace khādanīyam bhavissati khādissatha
translated: If there’s rice porridge, you can drink it. If there’s a meal, you can eat it. If there’s fresh food, you can eat it.

original: no ce bhavissati yāgu vā bhattaṁ vā khādanīyaṁ vā, piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjissathā”ti.
analyzed: no ce bhavissati yāgu vā bhattam vā khādanīyam vā piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjissatha ati
translated: But if there isn’t, you can go wandering for alms.”

original: Evampi kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānā rodantiyeva “yāguṁ detha, bhattaṁ detha, khādanīyaṁ dethā”ti;
analyzed: evam pi kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānāḥ rodantiyā iva yāgum detha bhattam detha khādanīyam detha ati
translated: But even though the monks told them this, they still cried, “Give us rice porridge! Give us a meal! Give us fresh food!”

original: senāsanaṁ uhadantipi ummihantipi.🔽Assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya dārakasaddaṁ.
analyzed: senāsanam uhadantipi ummihantipi  assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya dāraka sadda
translated: They even carried off the furniture.🔽Early in the morning the Buddha got up and heard the sound of children.

original: Sutvāna āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: sutvānaḥ āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: He asked Venerable Ānanda,

original: “kiṁ nu kho so, ānanda, dārakasaddo”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho saḥ ānanda dāraka saddo ti
translated: “Ānanda, what’s that sound of children?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi …pe…
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi pe
translated: Ānanda told him what was happening,🔽adding,

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū jānaṁ ūnavīsativassaṁ puggalaṁ upasampādentī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave bhikkhū jānam ūnavīsati vassam puggalam upasampādenti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the monks knowingly give the full ordination to people less than twenty years old?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …

original: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā jānaṁ ūnavīsativassaṁ puggalaṁ upasampādessanti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma te bhikkhave mogha purisāḥ jānam ūnavīsati vassam puggalam upasampādessanti
translated: “How can those foolish men knowingly give the full ordination to people less than twenty years old?

original: Ūnavīsativasso, bhikkhave, puggalo akkhamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya🔽ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ uppannānaṁ
analyzed: ūnavīsati vassaḥ bhikkhave puggalaḥ akkhamaḥ hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya  ḍa sama kasa vāta ātapa sarīsapa samphassānam duruttānam durāgatānam vacana pathānam uppannāna
translated: A person less than twenty years old can’t endure cold and heat;🔽hunger and thirst;

original: sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ
analyzed: sārīrikānam vedanānam dukkhānam tibbānam kharānam kaṭukānam asātānam amanāpānam pāṇa harānam
translated: horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects;

original: anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.🔽Vīsativassova kho, bhikkhave, puggalo khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya
analyzed: an adhivāsaka jātikaḥ hoti  vīsati vassā uva kho bhikkhave puggalaḥ khamaḥ hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya
translated: and rude and unwelcome speech.🔽He can’t endure bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

original: ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṁ duruttānaṁ durāgatānaṁ vacanapathānaṁ, uppannānaṁ
analyzed: ḍasama kasa vāta ātapa sarīsapa samphassānam duruttānam durāgatānam vacana pathāna uppannāna
translated: A person twenty years old can endure these things.

original: sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ
analyzed: sārīrikānam vedanānam dukkhānam tibbānam kharānam kaṭukānam asātānam amanāpānam pāṇa harānam
translated: He endures physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, and unpleasant sensations that arise—

original: adhivāsakajātiko hoti.
analyzed: adhivāsaka jātikaḥ hoti
translated: and he is patient with the teachings.

original: Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṁ vā bhiyyobhāvāya …pe…
analyzed: neta bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pasannānam vā bhiyyobhāvāya pe
translated: This will not lead to confidence in those without it or to the growth of confidence in those who have it.

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “na, bhikkhave, jānaṁ ūnavīsativasso puggalo upasampādetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave ūnavīsati vassaḥ puggalaḥ upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: ‘You should not give the full ordination to anyone you know is less than twenty years old.

original: Yo upasampādeyya, yathādhammo kāretabbo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ upasampādeyya yathādhammo kāretabbo ti
translated: If you do, you commit an offense entailing confession.’”

original: 37. Ahivātakarogavatthu
translated: The account of the disease of ahivāta

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataraṁ kulaṁ ahivātakarogena kālaṅkataṁ hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataram kulam ahi vātaka rogena kālaṅkatam hoti
translated: At one time a family had died from the disease of ahivāta.

original: Tassa pitāputtakā sesā honti.
analyzed: tassa pitāputtakā sesā honti
translated: Only the father and son were left.

original: Te bhikkhūsu pabbajitvā ekatova piṇḍāya caranti.
analyzed: te bhikkhūsu pabbajitvā ekatas va piṇḍāya caranti
translated: They went forth with the monks and went for alms together.

original: Atha kho so dārako pituno bhikkhāya dinnāya upadhāvitvā etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ dārakaḥ pitunaḥ bhikkhāya dinnāya upadhāvitvā etat avoca
translated: Then, when his father had received almsfood, the boy ran up and said,

original: “mayhampi, tāta, dehi;
analyzed: tāta dehi
translated: “Give me some, Dad.

original: mayhampi, tāta, dehī”ti.
analyzed: tāta dehi iti
translated: Give me some, Dad.”

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized them,🔽“How can the Sakyan monastics go for alms together with a boy?”

original: “abrahmacārino ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā.
analyzed: abrahmacārinaḥ ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā
translated: “These Sakyan monastics aren’t celibate.

original: Ayampi dārako bhikkhuniyā jāto”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi dārako bhikkhuniyā jātaḥ ti
translated: This child was also born from a monastic.”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: and they told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, ūnapannarasavasso dārako pabbājetabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave ūna pannarasa vassaḥ dārakaḥ pabbājetabbaḥ
translated: “You should not give the going forth to a boy who is less than fifteen years old.

original: Yo pabbājeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pabbājeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa upaṭṭhākakulaṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ ahivātakarogena kālaṅkataṁ hoti, dve ca dārakā sesā honti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ ānandassa upaṭṭhāka kulam saddham pasannam ahi vātaka rogena kālaṅkatam hoti dve ca dārakā sesāḥ honti
translated: On one occasion a family that was supporting Venerable Ānanda had died of cholera. Only two boys were left.

original: Te porāṇakena āciṇṇakappena bhikkhū passitvā upadhāvanti.
analyzed: te porāṇakena āciṇṇa kappena bhikkhū passitvā upadhāvanti
translated: As was their custom, they ran up to the monks when they saw them.

original: Bhikkhū apasādenti.🔽Te bhikkhūhi apasādiyamānā rodanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū apasādenti  te bhikkhūhi apasādiyamānāḥ rodanti
translated: But the monks discouraged them.🔽And because they were discouraged, they cried.

original: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ ānandassa etat ahosi
translated: Ānanda thought,

original: “bhagavatā paññattaṁ—
analyzed: bhagavatā paññatta
translated: “The Buddha has laid down that

original: ‘na ūnapannarasavasso dārako pabbājetabbo’ti.
analyzed: na ūna pannarasa vassaḥ dārakaḥ pabbājetabbaḥ ti
translated: you shouldn’t give the going forth to a boy who is less than fifteen years old.

original: Ime ca dārakā ūnapannarasavassā.
analyzed: ime ca dārakāḥ ūna pannarasa vassā
translated: But these boys are less than fifteen years old.

original: Kena nu kho upāyena ime dārakā na vinasseyyun”ti?
analyzed: kena nu kho upāyena ime dārakāḥ na vinasseyyunti
translated: “How can I make sure that these boys don’t get lost?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: He told the Buddha, who said,

original: “Ussahanti pana te, ānanda, dārakā kāke uḍḍāpetun”ti?
analyzed: ussahanti pana te ānanda dārakā kāke uḍḍāpetunti
translated: “But, Ānanda, are these boys able to scare away crows?”

original: “Ussahanti, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: ussahanti bhagavā ati
translated: “They are, Sir.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ūnapannarasavassaṁ dārakaṁ kākuḍḍepakaṁ pabbājetun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave ūna pannarasa vassam dārakam kākuḍḍepakam pabbājetun ti
translated: “I allow you to give the going forth to a boy who is able to scare away crows, even if he’s less than fifteen years old.”

original: 38. Kaṇṭakavatthu
analyzed: kaṇṭakavatthu
translated: The case of Kaṇṭaka

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa dve sāmaṇerā honti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa dve sāmaṇerāḥ honti
translated: At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had two novice monks:

original: kaṇṭako ca mahako ca.
analyzed: kaṇṭako ca mahako ca
translated: Kaṇṭaka and Mahinda.

original: Te aññamaññaṁ dūsesuṁ.
analyzed: te aññam aññam dūsesu
translated: They had sexual intercourse with each other.

original: Bhikkhū ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: bhikkhū ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks criticized and complained and spread it about,

original: “kathañhi nāma sāmaṇerā evarūpaṁ anācāraṁ ācarissantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma sāmaṇerāḥ evarūpam anācāram ācarissanti iti
translated: “How can novice monks misbehave like this?”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, ekena dve sāmaṇerā upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: na bhikkhave ekena dve sāmaṇerā upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: “You should not have two novice monks as your attendants.

original: Yo upaṭṭhāpeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ upaṭṭhāpeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 39. Āhundarikavatthu
analyzed: āhundarikavatthu
translated: The case of the roof-cover

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tattheva rājagahe vassaṁ vasi, tattha hemantaṁ, tattha gimhaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tattha iva rājagahe vassam vasi tattha hemanta tattha gimha
translated: At that time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha for the rainy season, for the cold season, and for the hot season.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized the monks,

original: “āhundarikā samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtiyānaṁ disā andhakārā, na imesaṁ disā pakkhāyantī”ti.🔽Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: āhundarikā samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam disāḥ andhakārāḥ naḥ imesam disā pakkhāyanti iti  assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: “The Sakyan monastics are like roof-covers. They don’t go out into the countryside.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people.🔽They told the Buddha,

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: who said to Venerable Ānanda,

original: “gacchānanda, avāpuraṇaṁ ādāya anupariveṇiyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ ārocehi—
analyzed: gaccha ānanda avāpuraṇam ādāya anupariveṇiyam bhikkhūnaṃ ārocehi
translated: “Go and tell the monks in the monastery precincts, Ānanda, to gather in the assembly hall.

original: ‘icchatāvuso bhagavā dakkhiṇāgiriṁ cārikaṁ pakkamituṁ.
analyzed: icchatā āvuso bhagavā dakkhiṇāgirim cārikam pakkamitu
translated: The Buddha wishes to set out on a walking tour through the southern country.

original: Yassāyasmato attho, so āgacchatū’”ti.
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ atthaḥ saḥ āgacchatu uti
translated: Those who wish may go.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā avāpuraṇaṁ ādāya anupariveṇiyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: eva bhanta iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissuṇitvā avāpuraṇam ādāya anupariveṇiyam bhikkhūnaṃ ārocesi
translated: “Yes, Sir.” And after replying, he took a key and announced to the monks in the attendance hall:

original: “icchatāvuso, bhagavā dakkhiṇāgiriṁ cārikaṁ pakkamituṁ.
analyzed: icchatā āvuso bhagavā dakkhiṇāgirim cārikam pakkamitu
translated: “Venerables, the Buddha wishes to go wandering in the Southern Hills.

original: Yassāyasmato attho, so āgacchatū”ti.
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ atthaḥ saḥ āgacchatu uti
translated: Any of you who wish to go with him should pack a small bowl and robe.”

original: Bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: The monks said,

original: “bhagavatā, āvuso ānanda, paññattaṁ dasavassāni nissāya vatthuṁ, dasavassena nissayaṁ dātuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavatā āvuso ānanda paññattam dasa vassāni nissāya vatthu dasa vassena nissayam dātu
translated: “The Buddha has laid down that you should stay with your mentor for ten years, and that you should give formal support for ten years.

original: Tattha ca no gantabbaṁ bhavissati, nissayo ca gahetabbo bhavissati, ittaro ca vāso bhavissati, puna ca paccāgantabbaṁ bhavissati, puna ca nissayo gahetabbo bhavissati.
analyzed: tattha ca no gantabbam bhavissati nissayaḥ ca gahetabbaḥ bhavissati ittaraḥ ca vāsaḥ bhavissati puna ca paccāgantabbam bhavissati puna ca nissayaḥ gahetabbaḥ bhavissati
translated: We’ll have to go there, receive formal support, stay for a while, return, and receive formal support again.

original: Sace amhākaṁ ācariyupajjhāyā gamissanti, mayampi gamissāma;
analyzed: sace amhākam ācariya upajjhāyāḥ gamissanti mayam pi gamissāma
translated: If our teachers and preceptors go, we’ll go too.

original: no ce amhākaṁ ācariyupajjhāyā gamissanti, mayampi na gamissāma.
analyzed: no ce amhākam ācariya upajjhāyāḥ gamissanti mayam pi na gamissāma
translated: If they don’t go, we won’t go either.

original: Lahucittakatā no, āvuso ānanda, paññāyissatī”ti.
analyzed: lahu cittakatā no āvuso ānanda paññāyissati iti
translated: We’re not keen on going.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā ogaṇena bhikkhusaṅghena dakkhiṇāgiriṁ cārikaṁ pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā ogaṇena bhikkhu saṅghena dakkhiṇāgirim cārikam pakkāmi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha traveled to the Southern Hills with a sangha of monks who were not his usual companions.

original: 40. Nissayamuccanakakathā
translated: The discussion about canceling the formal support

original: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇāgirismiṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā punadeva rājagahaṁ paccāgacchi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇā girismim yathābhirantam viharitvā punadeva rājagaham paccāgacchi
translated: When the Buddha had stayed at the Southern Hills for as long as he liked, he returned to Rājagaha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: He then said to Venerable Ānanda,

original: “kiṁ nu kho, ānanda, tathāgato ogaṇena bhikkhusaṅghena dakkhiṇāgiriṁ cārikaṁ pakkanto”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho ānanda tathāgataḥ ogaṇena bhikkhu saṅghena dakkhiṇāgirim cārikam pakkanto ti
translated: “Ānanda, why did I travel to the Southern Hills with a sangha of monks who were not my usual companions?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: Ānanda told him what had happened.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—🔽“anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena pañcavassāni nissāya vatthuṁ, abyattena yāvajīvaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi  anujānāmi bhikkhave byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena pañca vassāni nissāya vatthu abyattena yāvajīva
translated: The Buddha then gave a teaching, and addressed the monks:🔽‘A monk who is capable may live independently after five years. But one who is not capable must live with formal support for life.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena
translated: A monk who has five qualities may not live independently:

original: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena, na asekkhena
analyzed: na asekkhena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti na asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena na asekkhena
translated: He does not possess the aggregate of virtue of one beyond training, nor the aggregate of concentration of one beyond training, nor the aggregate of wisdom of one beyond training, nor the aggregate of emancipation of one beyond training, nor the aggregate of knowledge and vision of emancipation of one beyond training.

original: paññākkhandhena na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: paññā kkhandhena na asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena na asekkhena vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabba
translated: he doesn’t have the virtue, the concentration, the wisdom, the freedom, or the knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.🔽He should not live independently.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṁ.🔽Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti asekkhena samādhikkhandhena.🔽Asekkhena paññākkhandhena …🔽asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena …
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena  asekkhena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti asekkhena samādhi kkhandhena  asekkhena paññākkhandhena  asekkhena vimutti kkhandhena
translated: “A monk who has five qualities may live independently.

original: asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: asekkhena vimutti ñāṇa dassana kkhandhena samannāgataḥ hoti 🔽imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena
translated: He has the virtue, the concentration, the wisdom, the freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom of one who is fully trained.🔽He may live independently.”🔽The ninth section on the one who should not live independently is finished.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabba
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, he shouldn’t live independently.

original: Assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti—
analyzed: assaddhaḥ hoti ahirikaḥ hoti anottappī hoti kusītaḥ hoti muṭṭha sati hoti
translated: He’s without faith, conscience, or moral prudence; he’s lazy; and he has poor memory.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, he shouldn’t live independently.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena
translated: When a monk has five qualities, he may live independently.

original: Saddho hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, upaṭṭhitassati hoti—
analyzed: saddhaḥ hoti hirimā hoti ottappī hoti āraddha vīriyaḥ hoti upaṭṭhita sati hoti
translated: He has faith, conscience, moral prudence, energy, and mindfulness.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anissitena
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, he may live independently.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na anissitena vatthabba
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, he shouldn’t live independently.

original: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, appassuto hoti, duppañño hoti—

translated: I go for refuge to the Teaching,

translated: For a second time I go for refuge to the Sangha.🔽For a third time I go for refuge to the Buddha,🔽For a third time I go for refuge to the Teaching,🔽For a third time I go for refuge to the Sangha.’

analyzed: tatiyam pi buddham saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: For the third time I go to the Buddha for refuge,

original: Tatiyampi dhammaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi,
analyzed: tatiyam pi dhammam saraṇam gacchāmi
translated: For the third time I go to the Teaching for refuge,

original: Tatiyampi saṅghaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmī’ti.
analyzed: saṅgham saraṇam gacchāmi iti

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi tīhi saraṇagamanehi sāmaṇerapabbajjan”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave imehi tīhi saraṇa gamanehi sāmaṇera pabbajjanti

translated: Sāriputta then gave the going forth to Rāhula and gave him the full ordination.

original: Atha kho suddhodano sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho suddhodano sakko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho suddhodanaḥ sakkaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho suddhodanaḥ sakkaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Soon afterwards Suddhodana went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

analyzed: ekā aha bhante bhagavantam varam yācāmi iti  atikkanta varā kho gotama tathāgatā ati
translated: and said, “Sir, I have a request to make.”🔽“Buddhas don’t grant requests.”

original: “Yañca, bhante, kappati, yañca anavajjan”ti.
analyzed: yat ca bhante kappati yat ca an avajjanti

analyzed: vadehi gotama ati

analyzed: bhagavati me bhante pabbajite anappakam dukkham ahosi tathā nande adhimattam rāhule

analyzed: masam chindati masam chetvā nhārum chindati nhārum chetvā aṭṭhim chindati aṭṭhi

analyzed: chetvā aṭṭhimiñjam āhat ca tiṭṭhati
translated: cuts through the marrow, and stops there.

original: Sādhu, bhante, ayyā ananuññātaṁ mātāpitūhi puttaṁ na pabbājeyyun”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā suddhodanaṁ sakkaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: sādhu bhante ayyāḥ an anuññātam mātā pitūhi puttam na pabbājeyyunti  atha kho bhagavā suddhodanam sakkam dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi

original: Atha kho suddhodano sakko bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho suddhodanaḥ sakkaḥ bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitaḥ samādapitaḥ samuttejitaḥ sampahasitaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: King Suddhodana then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi

analyzed: na bhikkhave an anuññātaḥ mātā pitūhi putto pabbājetabbaḥ

original: Yo pabbājeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pabbājeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.🔽Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmim yathābhirantam viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikam pakkāmi  anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena sāvatthi tat avasari
translated: When the Buddha had stayed at Kapilavatthu for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṁ āyasmato sāriputtassa santike dārakaṁ pāhesi—

analyzed: imam dārakam theraḥ pabbājetu uti
